commit_message:
Devstack should install the trove-dashboad module by default

Devstack should install both the trove module and the
trove-dashboard module by default. Because the trove-dashboard
is an important package for Trove development. For example,
developers confirm Trove behaviors after they test code change.

trove-dashboard should be explicitly installed by Devstack. Currently
trove dashboard plugin installs trove-dashboard when horizon service
is enabled in local.conf. Thats facing the wrong way. Horizon should
be installed as a required package of trove-dashboard. Because
trove-dashboard is a independent python package of horizon and
trove-dashboard package requires horizon package.

Story: 2007462
Task: 39142
Signed-off-by: Hirotaka Wakabayashi <hiwkby@yahoo.com>
Change-Id: I5a8996d70517b95036b6c95080f2f1e8400cc8f4

subject: Adds a full example of devstack local.conf
messages: [{'account_id': 31737, 'date': '2020-03-26 10:17:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6732, 'date': '2020-03-26 10:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-26 10:17:31.000000000', 'message': 'Adds a full example of devstack local.conf

The current instructions of "How to use with devstack" should be more
accurate and consistent with instructions of "Install Trove in DevStack"
page[1].

Adding a trove-dashboard plugin line to local.conf which is shown in "
Install Trove in DevStack" page[1] is not enough. Because you will see
the following error after executing "./stack.sh"::

    ++ /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/devstack/plugin.sh:source:34 :   configure_trove_dashboard
    ++ /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/devstack/plugin.sh:configure_trove_dashboard:10 :   cp -a /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/_1710_database_panel_group.py /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/_1720_project_databases_panel.py /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/_1730_project_database_backups_panel.py /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/_1731_project_database_backups_panel.py /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/_1740_project_database_clusters_panel.py /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/_1760_project_database_configurations_panel.py /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/__init__.py /opt/stack/horizon/openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/
    cp: target '/opt/stack/horizon/openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/' is not a directory
    + /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/devstack/plugin.sh:configure_trove_dashboard:1 :   exit_trap

I propose to add a full example of local.conf that includes trove
plugin and horizon service. Devstack is a tool to make an all-in-one
OpenStack environment for development. It is natural that trove and
trove-dashboard will be installed together. By doing so, developers
can easily make an all-in-one trove-dashboard environment.

1: https://docs.openstack.org/trove/latest/install/install-devstack.html

Story: 2007462
Task: 39142
Signed-off-by: Hirotaka Wakabayashi <hiwkby@yahoo.com>
Change-Id: Id05348b4ba7cf55f21297933ac60f5b7fcc2edbd
'}]
commit_message:
Adds a full example of devstack local.conf

The current instructions of "How to use with devstack" should be more
accurate and consistent with instructions of "Install Trove in DevStack"
page[1].

Adding a trove-dashboard plugin line to local.conf which is shown in "
Install Trove in DevStack" page[1] is not enough. Because you will see
the following error after executing "./stack.sh"::

    ++ /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/devstack/plugin.sh:source:34 :   configure_trove_dashboard
    ++ /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/devstack/plugin.sh:configure_trove_dashboard:10 :   cp -a /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/_1710_database_panel_group.py /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/_1720_project_databases_panel.py /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/_1730_project_database_backups_panel.py /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/_1731_project_database_backups_panel.py /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/_1740_project_database_clusters_panel.py /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/_1760_project_database_configurations_panel.py /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/trove_dashboard/enabled/__init__.py /opt/stack/horizon/openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/
    cp: target '/opt/stack/horizon/openstack_dashboard/local/enabled/' is not a directory
    + /opt/stack/trove-dashboard/devstack/plugin.sh:configure_trove_dashboard:1 :   exit_trap

I propose to add a full example of local.conf that includes trove
plugin and horizon service. Devstack is a tool to make an all-in-one
OpenStack environment for development. It is natural that trove and
trove-dashboard will be installed together. By doing so, developers
can easily make an all-in-one trove-dashboard environment.

1: https://docs.openstack.org/trove/latest/install/install-devstack.html

commit_message:
openstack-base: pin setuptools < 46 to get horizon working

pyScss used by Horizon fails to work with setuptools > 46 version.

It's last release was in 2016 so probably no one fix it.
Let make sure that we get older version of setuptools.

Broken due to https://bugs.launchpad.net/kolla/+bug/1866961

Change-Id: I2a3fa657a3e1a9b8b0acb0b50bd4f3e98078f4ff

commit_message:
Add Cyborg device profile groups to request spec.

Find the name of the device profile, if any, in flavor extra specs.
Get its profile groups (equiv to flavor request groups) from Cyborg.
Parse/validate them similar to extra_specs.
Generate RequestGroup objects and add them to the request spec
   (in requested_resources field, following precedent).

Change-Id: Icd2ee9024dd4af0a7eb105eca14df8e458e9de77
Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction

subject: WIP [train-only] purge /etc/nftables/*
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 20172, 'name': 'Michele Baldessari', 'email': 'michele@acksyn.org', 'username': 'michele'}, {'_account_id': 21909, 'name': 'Bob Fournier', 'email': 'bfournie@redhat.com', 'username': 'bfournie'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 24245, 'name': 'Harald Jenss', 'email': 'hjensas@redhat.com', 'username': 'harald.jensas'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-25 20:18:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2020-03-25 20:25:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

should not we do it via ansible and for the undercloud only?'}, {'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2020-03-25 20:26:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-25 20:27:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> should not we do it via ansible and for the undercloud only?

Well this is train only and we run puppet already so this seems the less invasive bit? (note that ussuri and later are unaffected as they do not start nftables by default)

I think I will also add a comment in /etc/sysconfig/nftables as suggested by Bob'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-25 20:37:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > should not we do it via ansible and for the undercloud only?
 > 
 > Well this is train only and we run puppet already so this seems the
 > less invasive bit? (note that ussuri and later are unaffected as
 > they do not start nftables by default)
 > 
 > I think I will also add a comment in /etc/sysconfig/nftables as
 > suggested by Bob

I think also the OC is affected, we just never got there as we stumbled upon this on the UC'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-25 20:39:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-25 21:43:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-25 21:52:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-25 21:53:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-25 21:55:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-2

please put it in a host prep task instead.  This doesn't need to be in puppet"}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-26 06:56:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> please put it in a host prep task instead.  This doesn't need to be
 > in puppet

Won't re risk the following race:
1) nftables rpm is not on the host/image
2) host_prep_task does not do anything since /etc/sysconfig/nftables.conf does not exist
3) puppet runs, installs nftables and starts the service and we're back at square one?

I guess we could forcefully create an empty /etc/sysconfig/nftables.conf to be sure and hope the nftables rpm installation does not overwrite it (it should not), but it seems a bit more fragile in general. I wonder if we should do it in both tht and here"}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2020-03-26 10:52:35.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.opendev.org/715125 (master)
https://review.opendev.org/715130 (train)'}]

commit_message:
Add systemd-devel to neutron_devel_distro_packages

From upper-contraints we pull in systemd-python, which in turn
complains about missing libsystemd or libsystemd-journal

Change-Id: Ieaad930cf022e2d5ef4a6b580db16ad6454569e5

commit_message:
Deprecated shade client library

The kolla_keystone_service and kolla_keystone_user modules
of kolla-toolbox use the shade client library,
but the shade has been superceded by openstacksdk and
no longer takes new features, so the shade is deprecated
and the openstackSDK is used instead.

Change-Id: I3ffb69650fec7288b17d5c758a9af3ce0d4fe74f

commit_message:
Correct wrong template reference.

In [0] we cleaned up some variables that we barely used. However,
there was a mistake at the time of referencing the template to
build the overcloud_upgrade_run_x.sh script and the change referenced
to the overcloud_update_run template instead.

[0] - I443865bc95590a5cffcc28d98913110238e863b6

Change-Id: Idb99a214238f665cc49f66f1ac9baa4575f6b1ad

commit_message:
Retry few times when creating the initial connection to libvirtd.

It is possible that libvirtd is being started at the same time
as nova-compute service, so let's try a bit harder when creating
new connection or using connection methods.

Change-Id: Ie17714c8e3881f405450b5c4664bb961137de48b
Closes-Bug: #1654207

[{'created': '2020-03-24 22:33:21.000000000', 'message': 'Add keystone_region_name to magnum::keystone::domain

Is used to configure the trust/trustee_keystone_region_name

commit_message:
Correct os_user_role parameter from group_name to group

Changed the parameter to the os_user_role module from incorrect 'group_name'
to 'group' in line with the ansible docs:
https://docs.ansible.com/ansible/latest/modules/os_user_role_module.html

Change-Id: If2fced0fb579791f249c729d8aaeb5fb50e35620

subject: [Train only] Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers
messages: [{'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-03-25 13:05:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-03-25 13:06:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1\n\nwill be https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ansible/blob/master/tripleo_ansible/ansible_plugins/modules/container_puppet_config.py backported for Train?'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-03-25 13:21:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-03-26 07:41:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2020-03-26 09:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 13:05:07.000000000', 'message': "Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

When puppet configures related service containers, like ironic
or nova services, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel
containers.

Use flock to coordinate those. When a lock cannot be acquired for
either puppet or rsync after a 10 sec timeout, just fail it and allow
for retries to handle it.

In order to discover related config containers, use the common part of
its config volume prefixes. For example, container-puppet-nova_libvirt
and container-puppet-nova_api will have their shared locks stored in
the host's /var/lock/containers/nova/container-puppet dir also
bind-mounted as /var/lock/container-puppet for any of the other
container-puppet-nova_* config containers.

Also, in order to keep the timestamps of the puppet-generated/rsynced
files clean and isolated, release the lock only after all the required
timestamp-sensitive manipulations are done. That also provides better
isolation of configs and fences related services from unnecessary
restarts caused by unrelated config changes. Even if any made it
into config files having the same name, like nova.conf, but in fact
had been targeting different nova services.

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}, {'created': '2020-03-25 13:21:30.000000000', 'message': "[Train only] Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

or nova services, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel
containers.

Use flock to coordinate those. When a lock cannot be acquired for
either puppet or rsync after a 10 sec timeout, just fail it and allow
for retries to handle it.

In order to discover related config containers, use the common part of
its config volume prefixes. For example, container-puppet-nova_libvirt
and container-puppet-nova_api will have their shared locks stored in
the host's /var/lock/containers/nova/container-puppet dir also
bind-mounted as /var/lock/container-puppet for any of the other
container-puppet-nova_* config containers.

Also, in order to keep the timestamps of the puppet-generated/rsynced
files clean and isolated, release the lock only after all the required
timestamp-sensitive manipulations are done. That also provides better
isolation of configs and fences related services from unnecessary
restarts caused by unrelated config changes. Even if any made it
into config files having the same name, like nova.conf, but in fact
had been targeting different nova services.

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
[Train only] Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

When puppet configures related service containers, like ironic
or nova services, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel
containers.

Use flock to coordinate those. When a lock cannot be acquired for
either puppet or rsync after a 10 sec timeout, just fail it and allow
for retries to handle it.

In order to discover related config containers, use the common part of
its config volume prefixes. For example, container-puppet-nova_libvirt
and container-puppet-nova_api will have their shared locks stored in
the host's /var/lock/containers/nova/container-puppet dir also
bind-mounted as /var/lock/container-puppet for any of the other
container-puppet-nova_* config containers.

Also, in order to keep the timestamps of the puppet-generated/rsynced
files clean and isolated, release the lock only after all the required
timestamp-sensitive manipulations are done. That also provides better
isolation of configs and fences related services from unnecessary
restarts caused by unrelated config changes. Even if any made it
into config files having the same name, like nova.conf, but in fact
had been targeting different nova services.

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
fix race condition of instance host

During fix bug 1710509 find a race condition that when
doing rebuild or evacuate, there is a window the instance can become
ACTIVE but the host is still the old one before rebuild or
evacuate action , this can lead to potential issue if
a following actions submitted to nova api. nova api might
accept the request and because instance state already
ACTIVE, it is able to take actions but the instance.host is
incorrect.

Related-Bug: 1710509

Change-Id: Ib9462e9b74370bab6a601625babccf65e191d68b

[{'created': '2018-03-03 14:06:54.000000000', 'message': 'Disconnect and unreserve volume while boot from volume failed

Currently, if we create a new server that boots from a encrypted
bootable volume but encryption was not configured in nova. The new
server will build fail but the volume status stay in "in-use" state.

We should try-except around the encryptor attach attempt and disconnect
the volume before re-raising and then unreserve the volume to available
status.

Closes-Bug: 1745149

Change-Id: Ie43b39781078b7359fc0ade2f394e7b46792ceb7
'}]
commit_message:
Disconnect and unreserve volume while boot from volume failed

Currently, if we create a new server that boots from a encrypted
bootable volume but encryption was not configured in nova. The new
server will build fail but the volume status stay in "in-use" state.

We should try-except around the encryptor attach attempt and disconnect
the volume before re-raising and then unreserve the volume to available
status.

Closes-Bug: 1745149

Change-Id: Ie43b39781078b7359fc0ade2f394e7b46792ceb7

[{'created': '2018-02-02 21:32:31.000000000', 'message': 'improve support matrix notes

This cleans up the support matrix by:

 - Making format, phrasing, and terminology more consistent
 - Correcting errors, e.g. a reference to nova-network where neutron
   also applies
 - Moving driver-specific comments from the general notes to
   driver-notes-<driver>
 - Adding more information, e.g. maintenance mode deprecation
 - Removing redundant statements, e.g. saying something is optional
   when that is already indicated by the status field
 - Removing notes that do not help driver developers or end users,
   e.g. commentary on "a cloud model".
 - Removing sections that are not needed, e.g. operation.firewall
   had nothing to distinguish it from operation.securitygroups

During the process of checking some of these notes for accuracy, it
was discovered that one of the source files where multiattach is
implemented has a significant error in the comment about qemu and
libvirt version requirements. That is fixed here as well rather than
split a comment correction into its own commit.

Change-Id: Ibba91bcd67c167ed16461e70c49e9dd0da97e8a8

commit_message:
improve support matrix notes

This cleans up the support matrix by:

 - Making format, phrasing, and terminology more consistent
 - Correcting errors, e.g. a reference to nova-network where neutron
   also applies
 - Moving driver-specific comments from the general notes to
   driver-notes-<driver>
 - Adding more information, e.g. maintenance mode deprecation
 - Removing redundant statements, e.g. saying something is optional
   when that is already indicated by the status field
 - Removing notes that do not help driver developers or end users,
   e.g. commentary on "a cloud model".
 - Removing sections that are not needed, e.g. operation.firewall
   had nothing to distinguish it from operation.securitygroups

During the process of checking some of these notes for accuracy, it
was discovered that one of the source files where multiattach is
implemented has a significant error in the comment about qemu and
libvirt version requirements. That is fixed here as well rather than
split a comment correction into its own commit.

Change-Id: Ibba91bcd67c167ed16461e70c49e9dd0da97e8a8

[{'created': '2017-11-02 14:08:59.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Ironic: Get IP address for volume connector from ports/portgroups

Now, we're planning to add 'port' and 'portgroup' types to volume
connector resources in ironic for a case where a port or a portgroup
works as a volume connector such as iSCSI initiator. It makes it a
little easier to get an IP address for volume connector than using
mac addresses. This patch is a prototype for this fix.

blueprint ironic-volume-connector-ip

Change-Id: Iea089e2a9232352211268f91dfec6cf79f8bfac0

connector resources in ironic for a case where a port or a portgroup

little easier to get an IP address for volume connector than using
mac addresses. This patch is a prototype for this fix.

commit_message:
Ironic: Get IP address for volume connector from ports/portgroups

When iSCSI storage network is managed by neutron, an IP address for a
volume connector cannot be registered by an operator in advance. The IP
address of the connector may be required from some cinder backend
drivers. A port representing a NIC or a portgroup representing a pair
of bonded NICs can be registered as a volume connector for an Ironic
node.

This patch gets an IP address for a volume connector from a port
or a portgroup associated with the volume connector by seeing a VIF
attached to the port or the portgroup.

Implements: blueprint ironic-volume-connector-ip
Change-Id: Iea089e2a9232352211268f91dfec6cf79f8bfac0

commit_message:
Add rabbitmq_erlang_cookie tag for rabbitmq config

The puppet base profile invokes rabbitmq module that sets erlang cookie
via the rabbitmq_erlang_cookie provider, but default puppet tags omit
it. This ends up with hiera setting never applied for non-HA rabbitmq
container configs.

The HA one is not affected as it sets the cookie via explicit file
resource in the rabbitmq_bundle manifest.

Change-Id: I9cd1b773b4d4cc4cb2f4ea46015639770a037495
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-10-11 12:32:13.000000000', 'message': 'Move is_block_device_mapping to new_format_is_volume

driver.block_device.is_block_device_mapping had only 1 caller:
ComputeManager._default_block_device_names(). It was inconsistent with
the other methods called by that function, and additionally its name
did not accurately represent what it did.

This also removes the last caller of is_implemented, so we remove it.

Change-Id: I01be8dc24f806c4575932f0a4bff7f7bff3f077b
'}]
commit_message:
Move is_block_device_mapping to new_format_is_volume

driver.block_device.is_block_device_mapping had only 1 caller:
ComputeManager._default_block_device_names(). It was inconsistent with
the other methods called by that function, and additionally its name
did not accurately represent what it did.

This also removes the last caller of is_implemented, so we remove it.

Change-Id: I01be8dc24f806c4575932f0a4bff7f7bff3f077b

[{'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-03-25 10:33:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2020-03-26 02:20:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Unfortunately what you're seeing here is that dib-run-parts was installed without +x permissions; after further investigation I believe it is due to 

 https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/2041

this will happen basically anywhere dib is running out of a virtualenv, where the latest setuptools will be installed.

this should be fixed in 46.1.3 which was only released a few hours ago.  our next wheel build should pick it up"}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-03-26 08:34:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> Unfortunately what you're seeing here is that dib-run-parts was
 > installed without +x permissions; after further investigation I

 > 
 > https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/issues/2041
 > 
 > this will happen basically anywhere dib is running out of a
 > virtualenv, where the latest setuptools will be installed.
 > 
 > this should be fixed in 46.1.3 which was only released a few hours
 > ago.  our next wheel build should pick it up

Thanks Ian, I'll impatiently wait for that :)"}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-03-26 08:35:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

(1 comment)

Some comments:

I miss some doc around the tool, it's not really clear to me what it will do or when it's recommended to use it? (ie. when you scale up your network nodes, ...)

After the tool runs, the user is left in the dark not knowing what happened. WDYT about printing a summary of the gw layout *before* and *after*?

It'd be also nice to have a way to tell the tool more info. Imagine the case where an operator knows that a particular gw X will hold most of the bandwidth so it could use some weighting mechanism (this is definitely a follow up).

When this patch merges it'll break RDO packaging so it'd be nice to prepare the spec change in advance to include the new script in the RPM.

I'm just -1'ing this for discussion but the code looks good and it works :)
Thanks a lot!"}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-11-27 09:12:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

I correct myself about the "in the dark" comment. There's some INFO messages that are definitely useful. It'd be good IMO to have a summary of the situation before and after to be able to spot the work that the tool's done at a glance.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2019-11-27 14:32:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

What about a dry-run mode? ie. Something that tells you the current state, how the gateway ports / chassis will look like after the rebalance and then let the operator decide to run it at a later time whenever the impact has been assessed. Thoughts?'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-11-27 14:32:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

 > state, how the gateway ports / chassis will look like after the

+1, I can print pretty-table with actual and proposed state before running the rebalancing'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-11-27 14:55:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2019-11-27 15:56:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24: Code-Review+1

(4 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-11-28 09:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 25.'}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2019-11-28 09:33:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25: Workflow-1

(3 comments)

Thanks for the reviews.

There is a problem with properly estimate the actions during dry-run, because after each action (like move of LRP) I again call OVN dbs to get fresh numbers about particular chassis and LRP associations to it (to for example have the break point for loops). I'll need to modify the rebalancer a bit to properly estimate."}, {'account_id': 8655, 'date': '2020-01-03 13:53:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 25: Code-Review-2

networking-ovn master branch accepts no new patches anymore. The code has been merged into Neutron tree. Please re-propose the patch against Neutron if you think it's still relevant."}, {'account_id': 24791, 'date': '2020-03-26 07:57:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Add gateway chassis rebalance script

This patch adds new command:

    networking-ovn-rebalance-gw-chassis

which could be used to rebalance load across configured
gateway chassis [1]. Please be aware that use of it could
lead to temporary N/S traffic flap.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/653718/

Change-Id: I3d0a4d01e33edb68af6dcdaf30926e393a26be9c
Closes-Bug: #1732580

commit_message:
Disable voting for tripleo-ci-centos-7-containers-multinode

We need to disable it just for a moment to have [1] merged.
After that we're going to propose RDO patch and then revert
this one.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/663046

Change-Id: Ie55161edefbcb96146bcf4ede4db464472c37bf3

commit_message:
[DNM] Add syslog dump and key dump

In case of failed auth dump syslog logs and installed public
keys.

Change-Id: Iccc47d61ccd3ce57cc1cf218217ec7a84fdc8203

commit_message:
Enable heat tempest plugin for undercloud

Heat is heavily used in tripleo deployment. It is necessary to make
sure heat api works fine.

Enabling heat tempest plugin api tests might help.

Change-Id: Ibbca48f7f04cc46a7878b8c6f68225eabbabc6e7
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Port several legacy tempest jobs to Zuul v3

- cinder-tempest-lvm-multibackend is the simple LVM multibackend job
  and replaces legacy-tempest-dsvm-lvm-multibackend.
- remove legacy-tempest-dsvm-zeromq-multibackend, as ZeroMQ
  support was deprecated in Rocky and removed in Stein.
  It could be replaced by inheriting from
  cinder-tempest-lvm-multibackend in older branches
  when this patch is backported;
- replace cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican with
  cinder-tempest-dsvm-lvm-lio-barbican provided by
  cinder-tempest-plugins;
- replace legacy-tempest-dsvm-full-devstack-plugin-nfs with
  devstack-plugin-nfs-tempest-full, now provided by
  devstack-plugin-nfs;
- update cinder-plugin-ceph-tempest to also run cinderlib tests
  and make it inherit from devstack-plugin-ceph-tempest-py3.

Change-Id: Icdafaf55494b6dd74ec31c3572d7344fcc028166

[{'created': '2020-03-24 11:19:57.000000000', 'message': "Use global hosts entries to configure /etc/hosts

Global hosts entry block is evaluated via the HostsEntry stack output.
That one is joined from VipHosts and HostsEntryValue values stored in
Heat, which already take into account the UndercloudHostsEntries,
VipHosts, ExtraHostFileEntries and roles' hosts_entry.

So there is no need to duplicate extra entries via additional
parameters and ansible vars. Just use that HostsEntry as a single
source of truth for ansible role that configures the ultimate /etc/hosts
state.

commit_message:
Use global hosts entries to configure /etc/hosts

Global hosts entry block is evaluated via the HostsEntry stack output.
That one is joined from VipHosts and HostsEntryValue values stored in
Heat, which already take into account the UndercloudHostsEntries,
VipHosts, ExtraHostFileEntries and roles' hosts_entry.

So there is no need to duplicate extra entries via additional
parameters and ansible vars. Just use that HostsEntry as a single
source of truth for ansible role that configures the ultimate /etc/hosts
state.

Related-Bug: #1868588

commit_message:
Configure main registry as trunk.registry.rdoproject.org

Container registry for promotions moved to vexxhost and got
back its hostname: trunk.registry.rdoproject.org
No need to use "vexxhost" specific one.
Change-Id: I75b21dc7ec7a2594e5ffa1a26547b6dc4950bba7

subject: Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 13:37:37.000000000', 'message': "Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

When puppet configures related service containers, like ironic
or nova services, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel
containers.

Use flock to coordinate those. When a lock cannot be acquired for
either puppet or rsync after a 10 sec timeout, just fail it and allow
for retries to handle it.

In order to discover related config containers, use the common part of
its config volume prefixes. For example, container-puppet-nova_libvirt
and container-puppet-nova_api will have their shared locks stored in
the host's /var/lock/containers/nova/container-puppet dir also
bind-mounted as /var/lock/container-puppet for any of the other
container-puppet-nova_* config containers.

Also, in order to keep the timestamps of the puppet-generated/rsynced
files clean and isolated, release the lock only after all the required
timestamp-sensitive manipulations are done. That also provides better
isolation of configs and fences related services from unnecessary
restarts caused by unrelated config changes. Even if any made it
into config files having the same name, like nova.conf, but in fact
had been targeting different nova services.

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

When puppet configures related service containers, like ironic
or nova services, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel
containers.

Use flock to coordinate those. When a lock cannot be acquired for
either puppet or rsync after a 10 sec timeout, just fail it and allow
for retries to handle it.

In order to discover related config containers, use the common part of
its config volume prefixes. For example, container-puppet-nova_libvirt
and container-puppet-nova_api will have their shared locks stored in
the host's /var/lock/containers/nova/container-puppet dir also
bind-mounted as /var/lock/container-puppet for any of the other
container-puppet-nova_* config containers.

Also, in order to keep the timestamps of the puppet-generated/rsynced
files clean and isolated, release the lock only after all the required
timestamp-sensitive manipulations are done. That also provides better
isolation of configs and fences related services from unnecessary
restarts caused by unrelated config changes. Even if any made it
into config files having the same name, like nova.conf, but in fact
had been targeting different nova services.

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d38ec4ec26e06086b05b0b6534dc4639e977af44)

commit_message:
Do not race when applying puppet/rsync in containers

When puppet configures related service containers, like ironic
or nova services, there is potential rsync --delete-after race
condition with other rsync or puppet executions in parallel
containers.

Use flock to coordinate those. When a lock cannot be acquired for
either puppet or rsync after a 10 sec timeout, just fail it and allow
for retries to handle it.

In order to discover related config containers, use the common part of
its config volume prefixes. For example, container-puppet-nova_libvirt
and container-puppet-nova_api will have their shared locks stored in
the host's /var/lock/containers/nova/container-puppet dir also
bind-mounted as /var/lock/container-puppet for any of the other
container-puppet-nova_* config containers.

Also, in order to keep the timestamps of the puppet-generated/rsynced
files clean and isolated, release the lock only after all the required
timestamp-sensitive manipulations are done. That also provides better
isolation of configs and fences related services from unnecessary
restarts caused by unrelated config changes. Even if any made it
into config files having the same name, like nova.conf, but in fact
had been targeting different nova services.

Change-Id: I486ebf009cc1fc7d1cf2ce947fdd5c112930d125
Closes-bug: #1868934
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit d38ec4ec26e06086b05b0b6534dc4639e977af44)

[{'created': '2020-03-25 20:08:57.000000000', 'message': '[tests] Improve devstack/post playbook efficiency

By adjusting the syntax to the newer format, the fetch-subunit
role will be skipped entirely, rather than run with all its

Change-Id: I6ae5a63051d512eecb2a603af9d74ec139eb0877

commit_message:
[tests] Improve devstack/post playbook efficiency

By adjusting the syntax to the newer format, the fetch-subunit
role will be skipped entirely, rather than run with all its
tasks skipped. This gives us results sooner and burns less
electricity, making the world a better place. :)

Change-Id: I6ae5a63051d512eecb2a603af9d74ec139eb0877

commit_message:
Move py35 jobs to latest python3

glanceclient-tox-py35-keystone-tips and glanceclient-tox-py35-oslo-tips
jobs run on py35 which should be moved the newer python3 version.

Moving them to py3 env so that they can pickup the available
python version on running node.

Change-Id: I5fadbadf9eee2163ef6d17af2ceb49883151038c

Change-Id: I8e8035dcf508f5215bba9b7575c5c6abfe41da31
'}, {'created': '2020-03-11 15:45:24.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Use virDomainBlockCopy to swap volumes with Libvirt >= 5.10.0

Previously virDomainBlockRebase [1] was used by swap_volume to switch
between volumes presented to the compute host as block devices or files.

virDomainBlockCopy [2] is a superset of virDomainBlockRebase when the
VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_REBASE_COPY flag is provided as is the case within
swap_volume. As such we can switch to virDomainBlockCopy and expand
support for swap_volume outside of just host block devices and files.

In order to allow swap_volume to support RBD volumes we also need the
domain to use the recently introduced -blockdev support within Libvirt
>= 5.10.0. A new MIN_LIBVIRT_BLOCKDEV version constant is introduced and
used to determine when to switch to the virDomainBlockCopy method of
switching between volumes.

[1] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainBlockRebase
[2] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainBlockCopy

Change-Id: I8e8035dcf508f5215bba9b7575c5c6abfe41da31
'}, {'created': '2020-03-13 14:58:12.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Use virDomainBlockCopy to swap volumes with Libvirt >= 5.10.0

Previously virDomainBlockRebase [1] was used by swap_volume to switch
between volumes presented to the compute host as block devices or files.

As outlined in the virDomainBlockCopy [2] documentation this command is
actually a superset of virDomainBlockRebase in our case:

> This command is a superset of the older virDomainBlockRebase() when used
> with the VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_REBASE_COPY flag, and offers better control
> over the destination format, the ability to copy to a destination that
> is not a local file, and the possibility of additional tuning
> parameters.

As such we can switch to virDomainBlockCopy and expand support for
swap_volume outside of just host block devices and files.

To allow swap_volume to support RBD volumes we also need the domain to
use the recently introduced -blockdev support within Libvirt >= 5.10.0.
A new MIN_LIBVIRT_BLOCKDEV version constant is introduced and used to
determine when to switch to the virDomainBlockCopy method of switching
between volumes.

[1] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainBlockRebase
[2] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainBlockCopy

Change-Id: I8e8035dcf508f5215bba9b7575c5c6abfe41da31
'}, {'created': '2020-03-16 15:48:03.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Use virDomainBlockCopy to swap volumes when using -blockdev

Previously virDomainBlockRebase [1] was used by swap_volume to switch
between volumes presented to the compute host as block devices or files.

As outlined in the virDomainBlockCopy [2] documentation this command is
actually a superset of virDomainBlockRebase in our case:

> This command is a superset of the older virDomainBlockRebase() when used
> with the VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_REBASE_COPY flag, and offers better control
> over the destination format, the ability to copy to a destination that
> is not a local file, and the possibility of additional tuning
> parameters.

As such we can switch to virDomainBlockCopy and expand support for
swap_volume outside of just host block devices and files.

To allow swap_volume to support RBD volumes we also need the domain to
use the recently introduced -blockdev support within Libvirt >= 6.1.0
and QEMU >= 4.3.0. New MIN_LIBVIRT_BLOCKDEV and MIN_QEMU_BLOCKDEV
version constants are introduced and used to determine when to switch to
the virDomainBlockCopy method of switching between volumes.

[1] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainBlockRebase
[2] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainBlockCopy

Change-Id: I8e8035dcf508f5215bba9b7575c5c6abfe41da31

the virDomainBlockCopy method of moving between volumes.

[1] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainBlockRebase
[2] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainBlockCopy

Closes-Bug: #1868996
Change-Id: I8e8035dcf508f5215bba9b7575c5c6abfe41da31
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Use virDomainBlockCopy to swap volumes when using -blockdev

Previously virDomainBlockRebase [1] was used by swap_volume to switch
between volumes presented to the compute host as block devices or files.

As outlined in the virDomainBlockCopy [2] documentation this command is
actually a superset of virDomainBlockRebase in our case:

> This command is a superset of the older virDomainBlockRebase() when used
> with the VIR_DOMAIN_BLOCK_REBASE_COPY flag, and offers better control
> over the destination format, the ability to copy to a destination that
> is not a local file, and the possibility of additional tuning
> parameters.

As such we can switch to virDomainBlockCopy and expand support for
swap_volume outside of just host block devices and files.

To allow swap_volume to support RBD volumes we also need the domain to
use the recently introduced -blockdev support within libvirt >= 6.0.0
and QEMU >= 4.2.0. New MIN_LIBVIRT_BLOCKDEV and MIN_QEMU_BLOCKDEV
version constants are introduced and used to determine when to switch to
the virDomainBlockCopy method of moving between volumes.

[1] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainBlockRebase
[2] https://libvirt.org/html/libvirt-libvirt-domain.html#virDomainBlockCopy

Closes-Bug: #1868996
Change-Id: I8e8035dcf508f5215bba9b7575c5c6abfe41da31

commit_message:
Add further obsoletes for the dropped python 2.x packages

We need to uninstall the python2.x versions that are no longer
being built for being able to update in a rolling release distribution.

Change-Id: I2f96f4caf867681088f359e8271edbd17df960a6
(cherry picked from commit b64a1c4cc56814d7d8c7916c72eeb9d4d0addedb)

commit_message:
Revert "Revert "Revert "Disable github reporting and re-add devel ansible job"""

We really are done (as I write this) with debugging this.  We were
unable to reproduce the error.

This reverts commit 4b535151897b353523fd1589468f98fed3357309.

commit_message:
libvirt: Use oslo.utils >= 4.1.0 to fetch format-specific image data

This change is a follow up to I0c3f14100a18107f7e416293f3d4fcc641ce5e55
and removes the direct call to nova.privsep.qemu with one to the images
API that now returns an oslo_utils.imageutils.QemuImgInfo object.
Version 4.1.0 of oslo.utils introducing support for the format-specific
data returned by qemu-img info for LUKSv1 based images.

Change-Id: I573396116e10cf87f80f1ded55f2cd8f498859e4

Test cases for iLO driver in standalone ironic

This commit adds test cases to support deployment using
redfish driver and ipxe deploy using ilo driver with
standalone ironic.

commit_message:
Re-use swift_store_cacert for Keystone session

pass configured cacert for Swift to the keystoneauth's Session
as well so that the swift endpoint can be resolved from the catalog
when a custom CA bundle is used.

Change-Id: I439f6b5af34c685f72c9b4933c7eb0c77cc92e14
Closes-Bug: #1820817

commit_message:
Add VLAN type conntrack direct flow

For vlan type network, we add a segment match flow
to the openflow security group ingress table. Then
the packets will be recorded in conntrack table, and
the reply packets can be processed properly.

Conflicts:
    doc/source/contributor/internals/openvswitch_firewall.rst

Change-Id: Ieded0654d0ad16235ec923b822dcd842bd7735e5
Closes-Bug: #1831534
(cherry picked from commit aa58542e823d23d233524cd5639c7ec4bb757769)

commit_message:
Add 'description' field to the device profile object

Add the DeviceProfile objects version 1.1, and add 'description'
field to the DeviceProfile's fields.
And 'description' also will expose to end users from
the GET/POST response body.

Story: 2007397
Partial-Implements: blueprint add-description-field-to-device-profiles

Change-Id: I15fd9a430d09b20b55375b374fd7fd96542c6358

Add description column to device_profiles db

Add 'description' column to the ``device_profiles`` table,
and changes the ``DeviceProfile`` model.

Partial-Implements: blueprint add-description-field-to-device-profiles

commit_message:
Improve the accuracy of device profile API responses in docs

Now when we called the device profiles POST/GET API, that will return
response body, but in API docs, the responses body missing "created_at"
and "updated_at" fields, this commits add these missing properties
in device profile API docs.

Another change is that the adjustment responses are worth the correct
order.

Change-Id: I37817da2a8f7ee2aa2f6dd5b7ab2188c2035cefb

hi, there's a lot of duplicate code only due to es version.

commit_message:
Fix es2 issues and add es7 support.

1.When put template, there is no http headers,
so request would be failed.
2.Now, es storage is based on es 2.x,
it is out of date.

Change-Id: I05afcd15650f3f98ed57c6c850984b68faf4ae7a
Signed-off-by: yuanrunsen <yuanrunsen@unitedstack.com>

commit_message:
mariadb container name variable

mariadb container name variable is fixed in some places,
but in the defaults directory, mariadb container_name variable
is variable. If the mariadb container_name variable is changed
during deployment, it will not be assigned to container_name,
but a fixed 'mariadb' name.

Change-Id: Ie8efa509953d5efa5c3073c9b550be051a7f4f9b

commit_message:
Add realtime support to drive conversion

This patch updates change_physical_disk_state() so that it returns the
actual results of drive conversion on each controller.  This allows the
caller to use the returned information for realtime drive conversion.

This patch also deprecates returning the is_reboot_required and
commit_required_ids keys in the dictionary.

Change-Id: I10f4a44660e70f0cd8efd0ca9e8e96cb46751a61
(cherry picked from commit ff312640d8af2b2b18ab08bf725a4ee8f2e99bcf)

[{'created': '2020-03-24 09:53:01.000000000', 'message': "bug-fix: set do_cleanup always True for libvirt driver

For libvirt, do_cleanup is just a flag to mark if the instance_path is shared.
If the instance path is shared, that means we shouldn't cleanup the target or
source instance path. But that code path is already controlled by 'destroy_disks'
flag.

We have two operations based on this do_cleanup flag:
   a) rpc call 'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' on source host when
      rollback live migration
   b) driver.cleanup on source host when post live migration
Both a) and b) have other logic like undefine the domain, disconnect volume or
destory vif except for cleanup instance path. These operations shouldn't be
controlled by only do_cleanup flag.

So set do_cleanup always True for libvirt driver to complete other cleanup
except for deleting instance path.

Change-Id: I83e82a8e7d92c09c64848d17b327acce34f52efa

commit_message:
bug-fix: set do_cleanup always True for libvirt driver

For libvirt, do_cleanup is just a flag to mark if the instance_path is shared.
If the instance path is shared, that means we shouldn't cleanup the target or
source instance path. But that code path is already controlled by 'destroy_disks'
flag.

We have two operations based on this do_cleanup flag:
   a) rpc call 'rollback_live_migration_at_destination' on source host when
      rollback live migration
   b) driver.cleanup on source host when post live migration
Both a) and b) have other logic like undefine the domain, disconnect volume or
destory vif except for cleanup instance path. These operations shouldn't be
controlled by only do_cleanup flag.

So set do_cleanup always True for libvirt driver to complete other cleanup
except for deleting instance path.

Change-Id: I83e82a8e7d92c09c64848d17b327acce34f52efa

commit_message:
Fix population of username, public keys

The expand function was failing to add the username and public keys to
the instances list. This change treats these arguments like other
defaults, and adds tests to confirm they're ending up in the instances
list.

This change also has a minor fix to the unprovision prompt validation
logic.

Change-Id: I603623511e4061e782a65d53a3118d211ea6e708

commit_message:
Add realtime support to drive conversion

This patch updates change_physical_disk_state() so that it returns the
actual results of drive conversion on each controller.  This allows the
caller to use the returned information for realtime drive conversion.

This patch also deprecates returning the is_reboot_required and
commit_required_ids keys in the dictionary.

Change-Id: I10f4a44660e70f0cd8efd0ca9e8e96cb46751a61
(cherry picked from commit ff312640d8af2b2b18ab08bf725a4ee8f2e99bcf)

commit_message:
ring: Flag region, zone, and device as required in add_dev

They effectively already *were*, but if you used the RingBuilder API
directly (rather than the CLI) you could previously write down builders
that would hit KeyErrors on load.

Change-Id: I1de895d4571f7464be920345881789d47659729f

commit_message:
Mark security group fullstack tests as stable

It has been some time since we marked the security group tests in
fullstack as unstable.  Now that mark is impeding the fullstack tests
for stateless security groups.

Based on testing it appears that the unstable tests are specific to the
linuxbridge driver, which is not really very much supported these days.
Testing for that driver is dropped, since it is better to at least test
for the other scenarios than nothing at all.

Change-Id: Ib1ef0763496aa536ba80f1c34c64d8a6c313fd0b
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/710252
Related-bug: #1779328

[{'created': '2020-03-11 17:07:30.000000000', 'message': 'Fix queries to retrieve allocations with network_segment_range

Fixed the queries to retrieve the segment ID allocations when service
plugin network_segment_range is enabled. With the previous
implementation, a project user was able to allocate a segment ID
belonging to other project segment range.

The solution implemented was discussed in [1]:
- A project user will retrieve segments from the project ranges.
- When depleted, the segment IDs will be retrieved from the shared
  range, never using another project segment ID.

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-February/012736.html

Change-Id: I953062d9ee8ee5ee9a9f07aff4a8222ac63ed525
Closes-Bug: #1863423
(cherry picked from commit 046672247de56bad950e8267a57bd26205f354a0)

commit_message:
Fix queries to retrieve allocations with network_segment_range

Fixed the queries to retrieve the segment ID allocations when service
plugin network_segment_range is enabled. With the previous
implementation, a project user was able to allocate a segment ID
belonging to other project segment range.

The solution implemented was discussed in [1]:
- A project user will retrieve segments from the project ranges.
- When depleted, the segment IDs will be retrieved from the shared
  range, never using another project segment ID.

[1]http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-February/012736.html

Conflicts:
    neutron/objects/network_segment_range.py
    neutron/objects/plugins/ml2/base.py
    neutron/objects/plugins/ml2/vlanallocation.py
    neutron/objects/plugins/ml2/vxlanallocation.py

Change-Id: I953062d9ee8ee5ee9a9f07aff4a8222ac63ed525
Closes-Bug: #1863423
(cherry picked from commit 046672247de56bad950e8267a57bd26205f354a0)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-20 06:00:56.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Remove native openflow driver 'deferred' code"

This reverts commit d954cd4fea64fff3714d7bd1a609dea850c7f056.

Some flow installations [1] still need 'deferred' to improve the flow install performance, for instance openflow firewall.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py#L422-L475

Change-Id: Ie2d26f3820269271e7280b19f3206dd11aa99037
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Remove native openflow driver 'deferred' code"

This reverts commit d954cd4fea64fff3714d7bd1a609dea850c7f056.

Some flow installations [1] still need 'deferred' to improve the flow install performance, for instance openflow firewall.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/neutron/blob/master/neutron/agent/common/ovs_lib.py#L422-L475

Change-Id: Ie2d26f3820269271e7280b19f3206dd11aa99037

commit_message:
Use rally-openstack 1.7.0 for stable/stein

Master branch now has requirements incompatible with stable branches
constraints [0], so this switches to last tag compatible.

Longer term fix will be to run rally in a virtualenv, but this is lower
priority than other tasks. This can be revisited at the time, though for
older branches we will probably stick with pinned version

[0] https://opendev.org/openstack/rally-openstack/commit/5776e015f16321fdb489ebb482d984ccd3cd2903

Change-Id: Iad7434f6d75e067feba31882a6417368b1915294
Closes-Bug: #1868691

commit_message:
Refactor memcached_servers

This patch aims to add a prefix for memcached_server
on each role to give the ability for deployers to
override the location of memcached cluster. I.e users
wants to create a single memcached cluster with k8s
for each service.

We also add pymemcache based on [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/711429

Change-Id: I59fd6bd2e9557e8806e74bae8980ce322dcc748c

commit_message:
Introduce a base class for all OpenStack context

Currently this class is a new home for _iterate_per_tenants method
that was deprecated at rally framework.

Change-Id: I1f301455dc32c78270ed0411c6a79a5f2c68e827

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 16688, 'date': '2020-03-25 18:15:37.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-03-25 21:11:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 18:15:37.000000000', 'message': 'Force container deletion if namespace does not exist in service_kill

When a service is stopped using "service_kill" script and the
namespace where the container is running does not exist, the
container processi should be forced to stop from the root namespace.

A namespace where a process is running, can be deleted whitout
stopping the mentioned process. "ip netns identify <PID>" then
returns an empty string (root namespace).

This patch will prevent an endless loop in Neutron DHCP agent. As
reported in the related bug, when a DHCP agent is resync, the DHCP
helper (metadata proxy) is stopped. In case this process stop raises
an exception (for example if the namespace does not exist), schedules
again a resync, creating an endless loop.

Change-Id: I9bac918fcde80e6a2336bc3cf1e6972512298118
Closes-Bug: #1868607
(cherry picked from commit c516df9e519745eaea1d8699e8374dff47fb6d24)
'}]
commit_message:
Force container deletion if namespace does not exist in service_kill

When a service is stopped using "service_kill" script and the
namespace where the container is running does not exist, the
container processi should be forced to stop from the root namespace.

A namespace where a process is running, can be deleted whitout
stopping the mentioned process. "ip netns identify <PID>" then
returns an empty string (root namespace).

This patch will prevent an endless loop in Neutron DHCP agent. As
reported in the related bug, when a DHCP agent is resync, the DHCP
helper (metadata proxy) is stopped. In case this process stop raises
an exception (for example if the namespace does not exist), schedules
again a resync, creating an endless loop.

Change-Id: I9bac918fcde80e6a2336bc3cf1e6972512298118
Closes-Bug: #1868607
(cherry picked from commit c516df9e519745eaea1d8699e8374dff47fb6d24)

commit_message:
Do not become `horizon` user for distro installs

Compiling messages as horizon user during distro installs results in
permissions error due to the fact that libraries are owned by root user
and been already compiled by distro package hook (for some distros)

Change-Id: If6e3b48b68e0018e0122d76bf49dfbe569ce96ce

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix check_for_ha_chassis_group_address maintenance task

Add a default value to the max() built-in method while looking for the
highest priority chassis in the HA Chassis Group and to avoid the
following error:

2020-03-20 10:05:35.160 27 ERROR futurist.periodics   File
"/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/futurist/periodics.py", line 293, in
run
2020-03-20 10:05:35.160 27 ERROR futurist.periodics     work()
2020-03-20 10:05:35.160 27 ERROR futurist.periodics   File
"/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/futurist/periodics.py", line 67, in
__call__
2020-03-20 10:05:35.160 27 ERROR futurist.periodics     return
self.callback(*self.args, **self.kwargs)
2020-03-20 10:05:35.160 27 ERROR futurist.periodics   File
"/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/futurist/periodics.py", line 181, in
decorator
2020-03-20 10:05:35.160 27 ERROR futurist.periodics     return f(*args,
**kwargs)
2020-03-20 10:05:35.160 27 ERROR futurist.periodics   File
"/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/ovn/mech_driver/ovsdb/maintenance.py",
line 576, in check_for_ha_chassis_group_address
2020-03-20 10:05:35.160 27 ERROR futurist.periodics     high_prio_ch =
max(default_ch_grp.ha_chassis, key=lambda x: x.priority)
2020-03-20 10:05:35.160 27 ERROR futurist.periodics ValueError: max()
arg is an empty sequence

Change-Id: Ifeb1ed8a4eac1d2c34a2d1d306a41708d80b4110
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Pre-focal-enablement for rabbitmq-server charm

This patch updates the rabbitmq charm to work on focal as part of other
test bundles, but does not update the charm for testing on focal. Hence
focal/ussuri bundles are not added and the metadata.yaml does NOT
include focal in this patchset.

A further patchset will be submitted that adds the focal testing to the
charm.  In particular, this patchset is required for the cinder focal
enablement.

Change-Id: Ia239b7c2f0ed2383e220cf0fa4ade443149a3b32

commit_message:
Update Rackspace vendor profile for cinder v2

Rackspace only has v1 in the catalog but run a cinder that supports
v2. Since SDK doesn't have support for v1 at all, update our
vendor config with an endpoint override for their block-storage
service.

As a special bit of hell, the url needs the project_id appended
which we cannot do with our normal format substitutions, so put in
YET ANOTHER Rackspace specific workaround logic.

Story: 2007459
Task: 39146
Change-Id: I4e6485b936b6b7303b6463cbacd3bf98746fc5e1

commit_message:
[ceph-client] Set num PGs to small value for a pg autoscaling bug

This is to workaround a pg merging bug in ceph. The number of PGs
is set to a small value. The reason this works is because the
pg autoscaler is set to work unconditionally. This will need
to change once the autoscaler is optional.

Change-Id: I6ec404f281e201023fa974601d7083f4ce3cfd30

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-01-16 15:07:29.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add utility function to get Cyborg client.

Need to add following to nova.conf and nova-cpu.conf:
[cyborg]
url=http://<controller-host>/accelerator/v2

For Cyborg client code, see:
   https://review.openstack.org/#/c/628924/
and its dependencies.

Change-Id: Iee0766269d61948ad701911e8b0e5e24d3d6eb04
Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction
'}, {'created': '2019-01-22 20:36:22.000000000', 'message': "WIP: ksa auth conf and client for cyborg access

Framework for communication with the cyborg API.

- Standard keystoneauth1 config options for setting up authentication in
the [cyborg] section of nova*.conf.
- A new nova.accelerator.cyborg module containing a get_client method to
return a (singleton) client ontaining a keystoneauth1 adapter pointing
to the cyborg service.
- Requirements updates to pull in the os-service-types release
containing the 'accelerator' service type.

WIP: test (?)
WIP: ost release, u-c bump

Change-Id: Iee0766269d61948ad701911e8b0e5e24d3d6eb04
Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction
"}, {'created': '2019-01-22 22:15:01.000000000', 'message': "ksa auth conf and client for cyborg access

Framework for communication with the cyborg API.

- Standard keystoneauth1 config options for setting up authentication in
the [cyborg] section of nova*.conf.
- A new nova.accelerator.cyborg module containing a get_client method to
return a (singleton) client ontaining a keystoneauth1 adapter pointing
to the cyborg service.
- Requirements updates to pull in the os-service-types release
containing the 'accelerator' service type.

u-c bump for os-service-types:

Framework for communication with the Cyborg API.

- Standard keystoneauth1 config options for setting up authentication in
the [cyborg] section of nova*.conf.
- A new nova.accelerator.cyborg module containing a get_client method to
return a client containing a keystoneauth1 adapter pointing
to the Cyborg service with user- and service- based authentication.
- Requirements updates to pull in the os-service-types release
containing the 'accelerator' service type.

Change-Id: Iee0766269d61948ad701911e8b0e5e24d3d6eb04

commit_message:
ksa auth conf and client for Cyborg access

Framework for communication with the Cyborg API.

- Standard keystoneauth1 config options for setting up authentication in
the [cyborg] section of nova*.conf.
- A new nova.accelerator.cyborg module containing a get_client method to
return a client containing a keystoneauth1 adapter pointing
to the Cyborg service with user- and service- based authentication.
- Requirements updates to pull in the os-service-types release
containing the 'accelerator' service type.

Change-Id: Iee0766269d61948ad701911e8b0e5e24d3d6eb04
Blueprint: nova-cyborg-interaction

commit_message:
Don't look up project by id if given id

There is a much deeper and systemic issue going on here, but let's
start with fixing the immediate issue which is that adding a project
to an image fails trying to look up project information even if the
user passes the project id by id.

_is_uuid_like from sdk isn't perfect, but it'll be good enough
for this.

Change-Id: I541416d737b961c56aa2f584c172528632fd5537

commit_message:
Fix ansible_pkg_mgr

ansible_pkg_mgr isn't in facts apparently, it's available from ansible
vars directly.

Change-Id: I21462446aeb01bbd280ee9c0cf9ef2bb222425b0

subject: Return false for MBR bootloader check on UEFI machines
messages: [{'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2020-03-25 18:36:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2020-03-25 18:47:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 18:36:18.000000000', 'message': 'Return false for MBR bootloader check on UEFI machines

Somewhat common are dual boot images that have both a MBR loader
and the contents required for a UEFI boot, as largely the pointer
to where to begin reading the rest of the boot loader occurs in
the first few hundred bytes on disk which redirects the disk to
begin reading from a known address.

This goes sideways on UEFI machines where this method of booting
is not recognized nor supported. Thus we need to return false when
we encounter this state.

Change-Id: I8c0b42bb71b9e26ed7fec8894e21ce7fc06b94a1
Story: 2007455
Task: 39133
(cherry picked from commit 81137d40459a7cafb04279acb079b2e004dc97f7)
'}]
commit_message:
Return false for MBR bootloader check on UEFI machines

Somewhat common are dual boot images that have both a MBR loader
and the contents required for a UEFI boot, as largely the pointer
to where to begin reading the rest of the boot loader occurs in
the first few hundred bytes on disk which redirects the disk to
begin reading from a known address.

This goes sideways on UEFI machines where this method of booting
is not recognized nor supported. Thus we need to return false when
we encounter this state.

Change-Id: I8c0b42bb71b9e26ed7fec8894e21ce7fc06b94a1
Story: 2007455
Task: 39133
(cherry picked from commit 81137d40459a7cafb04279acb079b2e004dc97f7)

[{'created': '2020-03-19 18:43:39.000000000', 'message': 'nova-live-migration: Ensure subnode is fenced during evacuation testing

As stated in the forced-down API [1]:

> Setting a service forced down without completely fencing it will
> likely result in the corruption of VMs on that host.

Previously only the libvirtd service was stopped on the subnode prior to
calling this API, allowing n-cpu, q-agt and the underlying guest domains
to continue running on the host.

This change now ensures all devstack services are stopped on the subnode
and all active domains destroyed.

It is hoped that this will resolve bug #1813789 where evacuations have
timed out due to VIF plugging issues on the new destination host.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=update-forced-down-detail#update-forced-down

commit_message:
nova-live-migration: Ensure subnode is fenced during evacuation testing

As stated in the forced-down API [1]:

> Setting a service forced down without completely fencing it will
> likely result in the corruption of VMs on that host.

Previously only the libvirtd service was stopped on the subnode prior to
calling this API, allowing n-cpu, q-agt and the underlying guest domains
to continue running on the host.

This change now ensures all devstack services are stopped on the subnode
and all active domains destroyed.

It is hoped that this will resolve bug #1813789 where evacuations have
timed out due to VIF plugging issues on the new destination host.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=update-forced-down-detail#update-forced-down

NOTE(lyarwood): The following change is squashed here to allow both to
pass the gate without encoutering additional failures.

nova-live-migration: Only stop n-cpu and q-agt during evacuation testing

I8af2ad741ca08c3d88efb9aa817c4d1470491a23 started to correctly fence the
subnode ahead of evacuation testing but missed that c-vol and g-api
where also running on the host. As a result the BFV evacuation test will
fail if the volume being used is created on the c-vol backend hosted on
the subnode.

This change now avoids this by limiting the services stopped ahead of
the evacuation on the subnode to n-cpu and q-agt.

Change-Id: Ia7c317e373e4037495d379d06eda19a71412d409
Closes-Bug: #1868234
(cherry picked from commit 1e16b3184d4e298c454ede7c56040f6d70276a0c)

Related-Bug: #1813789
Change-Id: I8af2ad741ca08c3d88efb9aa817c4d1470491a23
(cherry picked from commit b097959c1cbc9af1d90c7502286bc3e20972201f)
(cherry picked from commit 91d410b92f86524dffb781c7a49ecb3ec8ac8a56)

commit_message:
Refactor memcached_servers

This patch aims to add a prefix for memcached_server
on each role to give the ability for deployers to
override the location of memcached cluster. I.e users
wants to create a single memcached cluster with k8s
for each service.

We also add pymemcache based on [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/711429

Change-Id: I57796a7e6d99fc40af0647b3004fed95ce9f298f

commit_message:
Do not try to execute transaction if command list is empty

If command list is empty we can just early exit.

Change-Id: I99181078af46540e2e58feeea161509d62e22045

On base operating systems that use DNF there can be a systemd timer
that attempts to call out and update the dnf cache every hour.
This patch adds an diskimage-builder element that disables this
timer as most amphora will not be successful in updating this cache
because they do not have network access or DNS services avaialable.

commit_message:
Stop "dnf makecache" in the amphora images

On base operating systems that use DNF there can be a systemd timer
that attempts to call out and update the dnf cache every hour.
This patch adds an diskimage-builder element that disables this
timer as most amphora will not be successful in updating this cache
because they do not have network access or DNS services avaialable.

Change-Id: I5dec631d3e66e1dfb6b8741caea89938ee18a7d8
Story: 2007408
Task: 39019
(cherry picked from commit c8b044af4a82a670e1a6ee61fa9773e4f7fe5774)

commit_message:
Improve metadata server performance with large security groups

Don't include the rules in the SG fetch in the metadata server, since
we don't need them there, and with >1000 rules, it starts to get
really slow, especially in Pike and later.

Closes-Bug: #1851430

Co-Authored-By: Doug Wiegley <dougwig@parkside.io>
Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem.os@gmail.com>

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/network/security_group/test_neutron_driver.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict is due to not having change
I31c9ea8628c6f3985f8e9118d9687bbfb8789b68 in Pike.

Change-Id: I7de14456d04370c842b4c35597dca3a628a826a2
(cherry picked from commit eaf16fdde59a14fb38df669b21a911a0c2d2576f)

commit_message:
Refactor memcached_servers

This patch aims to add a prefix for memcached_server
on each role to give the ability for deployers to
override the location of memcached cluster. I.e users
wants to create a single memcached cluster with k8s
for each service.

We also add pymemcache based on [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/711429

Change-Id: Ieca2e8cd7959005f354412eb5a9f17b4363a5853

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 14:12:18.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] Pin neutron-tempest-plugin to 0.9.0

manila's IPv6 jobs setup bgp with the help of
neutron-dynamic-routing. The jobs enable
neutron-dynamic-routing using its devstack
plugin to install it alongside openstack/neutron.

neutron-tempest-plugin is a "branchless" tempest
plugin to the neutron project. We don't need to
install or run this tempest plugin in manila test
jobs. However, it is imported by test code within
the neutron-dynamic-routing project, forcing us to
include it in the list of requirements for the IPv6
jobs.

neutron-tempest-plugin dropped support for python3
in ussuri. python3 only code was added to
neutron-tempest-plugin causing failures in the
voting ipv6 lvm test job
(manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm).

So, pin the version of neutron-tempest-plugin we're
pulling in to a tagged git ref when the plugin last
supported python2.

Change-Id: I82854d0f9075e6fc7d33c6459d71d7f0d502ff3c
Closes-Bug: #1868905
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9b2753084559bf8fe415770e71e18a1477760ddb)
'}]
commit_message:
[stable-only] Pin neutron-tempest-plugin to 0.9.0

manila's IPv6 jobs setup bgp with the help of
neutron-dynamic-routing. The jobs enable
neutron-dynamic-routing using its devstack
plugin to install it alongside openstack/neutron.

neutron-tempest-plugin is a "branchless" tempest
plugin to the neutron project. We don't need to
install or run this tempest plugin in manila test
jobs. However, it is imported by test code within
the neutron-dynamic-routing project, forcing us to
include it in the list of requirements for the IPv6
jobs.

neutron-tempest-plugin dropped support for python3
in ussuri. python3 only code was added to
neutron-tempest-plugin causing failures in the
voting ipv6 lvm test job
(manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm).

So, pin the version of neutron-tempest-plugin we're
pulling in to a tagged git ref when the plugin last
supported python2.

Change-Id: I82854d0f9075e6fc7d33c6459d71d7f0d502ff3c
Closes-Bug: #1868905
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 9b2753084559bf8fe415770e71e18a1477760ddb)

Add further obsoletes for the dropped python 2.x packages

We need to uninstall the python2.x versions that are no longer
being built for being able to update in a rolling release distribution.

commit_message:
Enable Glance to use Cinder iSCSI backend

To use an iSCSI Cinder backend as its store, glance_api must run
privileged and have /dev and /etc/iscsi properly mounted

Co-authored-by: Radosaw Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I988d3c9d0564483440ae17203ad88a8049abbea4
Closes-Bug: #1855695

commit_message:
Stop running puppet centos-7 jobs on infra puppet

We don't deploy on centos 7 anymore so don't need these jobs (and this
one is failing).

Change-Id: I6b1cab9249c292fc782fc0ea77871a41b0a5c2fd

subject: Exclude acpid on Red Hat family DIB builds
messages:
[{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-03-23 16:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2020-03-23 20:50:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

So FWIW, acpid is meaningless on systems other than Intel/AMD (32 and 64 bits) and arm64, the fact that ubuntu ships acpid for ppc64le (Grr ppc64el) is an ubuntu bug and I recommend against codifying that in Octavia.'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2020-03-23 21:32:53.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Evidently this is not needed now, so abandoning.
I disagree with Tony's stance, as I think maintaining compatibility with the current build for other OS families is the best solution until these are moved out of the element (back into DIB) again."}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2020-03-23 23:54:42.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

This is needed sooner and will need to be accommodated in DIB when we move back there.'}, {'account_id': 12898, 'date': '2020-03-23 23:56:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> I disagree with Tony's stance, as I think maintaining compatibility
 > with the current build for other OS families is the best solution
 > until these are moved out of the element (back into DIB) again.

That's fine we can agree to disagree :)  We need something like this soon.  This will work and as you say maintains [bug]compatibility with what's already being done."}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2020-03-24 15:21:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 10806, 'date': '2020-03-25 15:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Just ran this change on a ppc64le machine running RHEL 8.  Image built successfully.'}, {'account_id': 10850, 'date': '2020-03-25 17:24:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-23 16:27:11.000000000', 'message': 'Exclude acpid on Red Hat family DIB builds

Red Hat/centos do not ship acpid for ppc64le, but others do.
This patch sets up a package map for DIB to exclude the acpid
package on Red Hat family image builds, while allowing it for the
other distros.

Change-Id: Iaef520e5f2a66833228e824ec4fb41f5915169af
'}]
commit_message:
Exclude acpid on Red Hat family DIB builds

Red Hat/centos do not ship acpid for ppc64le, but others do.
This patch sets up a package map for DIB to exclude the acpid
package on Red Hat family image builds, while allowing it for the
other distros.

Change-Id: Iaef520e5f2a66833228e824ec4fb41f5915169af

commit_message:
Create *-messages container when setting deployment status

This used to be created earlier by the mistral workflows running before
setting the status. As we've removing those, it has to be created,
if does not exist.

Change-Id: I9600f8b08391b36eae02a051713967b932fa06d3

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-23 14:53:47.000000000', 'message': 'Return false for MBR bootloader check on UEFI machines

Somewhat common are dual boot images that have both a MBR loader
and the contents required for a UEFI boot, as largely the pointer
to where to begin reading the rest of the boot loader occurs in
the first few hundred bytes on disk which redirects the disk to
begin reading from a known address.

This goes sideways on UEFI machines where this method of booting
is not recognized nor supported. Thus we need to return false when
we encounter this state.

Change-Id: I8c0b42bb71b9e26ed7fec8894e21ce7fc06b94a1
Story: 2007455
Task: 39133
'}, {'created': '2020-03-23 17:41:12.000000000', 'message': 'Return false for MBR bootloader check on UEFI machines

Somewhat common are dual boot images that have both a MBR loader
and the contents required for a UEFI boot, as largely the pointer
to where to begin reading the rest of the boot loader occurs in
the first few hundred bytes on disk which redirects the disk to
begin reading from a known address.

This goes sideways on UEFI machines where this method of booting
is not recognized nor supported. Thus we need to return false when
we encounter this state.

Change-Id: I8c0b42bb71b9e26ed7fec8894e21ce7fc06b94a1
Story: 2007455
Task: 39133
'}]
commit_message:
Return false for MBR bootloader check on UEFI machines

Somewhat common are dual boot images that have both a MBR loader
and the contents required for a UEFI boot, as largely the pointer
to where to begin reading the rest of the boot loader occurs in
the first few hundred bytes on disk which redirects the disk to
begin reading from a known address.

This goes sideways on UEFI machines where this method of booting
is not recognized nor supported. Thus we need to return false when
we encounter this state.

Change-Id: I8c0b42bb71b9e26ed7fec8894e21ce7fc06b94a1
Story: 2007455
Task: 39133

commit_message:
Improve support for HTTP proxy

- Configure the package manager (yum or dnf) to support the proxy
  parameter.
- Pass the proxy parameters when using redhat_subscription module.
- Adding rhsm_rhsm_proxy_proto to not hardcode http in the proxy
  url.

rhbz#1816255

Change-Id: I64b2dc97c512cecb7f4e6bcfa283733b3f2c1dc8

'}]
commit_message:
CentOS 8: Drop trickle install to build freezer

Trickle was previously installed from EPEL7, but is not available in
EPEL8. It does not appear critical to the functioning of freezer, so
drop it to allow freezer images to build for CentOS 8.

Change-Id: I3e12ab51e9f01d383268d75ce72903686564ada6
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8
(cherry picked from commit 548144fc3c2564c9c44a3a42372a1f3b8f2fef34)

commit_message:
Refactor memcached_servers

This patch aims to add a prefix for memcached_server
on each role to give the ability for deployers to
override the location of memcached cluster. I.e users
wants to create a single memcached cluster with k8s
for each service.

We also add pymemcache based on [1]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/711429

Change-Id: Iefac95507d189b86371026e17465adf15b1bf410

[{'created': '2020-03-10 23:43:22.000000000', 'message': 'Stop "dnf makecache" in the amphora images

On base operating systems that use DNF there can be a systemd timer
that attempts to call out and update the dnf cache every hour.
This patch adds an diskimage-builder element that disables this
timer as most amphora will not be successful in updating this cache
because they do not have network access or DNS services avaialable.

commit_message:
Stop "dnf makecache" in the amphora images

On base operating systems that use DNF there can be a systemd timer
that attempts to call out and update the dnf cache every hour.
This patch adds an diskimage-builder element that disables this
timer as most amphora will not be successful in updating this cache
because they do not have network access or DNS services avaialable.

Change-Id: I5dec631d3e66e1dfb6b8741caea89938ee18a7d8
Story: 2007408
Task: 39019
