revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 06:37:55.000000000', 'message': "Exclude repo_build_global_links_path from sync

These files are only used by the repo_build during wheel requirements
and should only be needed and used on the repo_container they're on.

When you're transitioning from one distribution release to another,
e.g. xenial -> bionic, syncing the links directory between these
repo_containers can break the wheel building in weird ways.

Depends-on: I3bd6d3d987e32ee11c5f1fcb5c1b4b0fc797e7f9
Change-Id: Iaa2e52b26ba89802e06665ebe43fdf18e515abd7
(cherry picked from commit 860224c64e69a9ebba4450c26730de1de74532ab)
"}]
commit_message:
Exclude repo_build_global_links_path from sync

These files are only used by the repo_build during wheel requirements
and should only be needed and used on the repo_container they're on.

When you're transitioning from one distribution release to another,
e.g. xenial -> bionic, syncing the links directory between these
repo_containers can break the wheel building in weird ways.

Depends-on: I3bd6d3d987e32ee11c5f1fcb5c1b4b0fc797e7f9
Change-Id: Iaa2e52b26ba89802e06665ebe43fdf18e515abd7
(cherry picked from commit 860224c64e69a9ebba4450c26730de1de74532ab)

[{'created': '2020-03-24 20:51:16.000000000', 'message': "[ci] Stop requiring neutron-tempest-plugin

We needed this plugin because neutron-dynamic-plugin's
code base included its tempest plugin in-tree. This
issue was addressed in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695014/.

So we no longer need to install neutron-tempest-plugin
in manila jobs.

Change-Id: I34b77c95aad7ee2b67ba876db8aa64bbc44adb79
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
[ci] Stop requiring neutron-tempest-plugin

We needed this plugin because neutron-dynamic-plugin's
code base included its tempest plugin in-tree. This
issue was addressed in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695014/.

So we no longer need to install neutron-tempest-plugin
in manila jobs.

Change-Id: I34b77c95aad7ee2b67ba876db8aa64bbc44adb79
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - Legacy volume not found

The equals check is too stringent for legacy pre Pike volumes
after an upgrade.  Pre PIke is SMI-S, Pike and later is REST
and identifier name is persisted differently.

Change-Id: I963ad219c2e3b1c9c5edaa8f7e0d3dea911ecd8e
Closes-Bug: #1867163

subject: WIP Remove eventhandler thread
messages:
[{'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2020-03-18 15:07:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2020-03-18 18:31:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

unit/contraints easy, tempest not a good sign.'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2020-03-25 16:15:25.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Can't do this due to events that themselves try to commit transactions."}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-18 15:07:42.000000000', 'message': 'WIP Remove eventhandler thread

For now, just looking at how tests react to this.

We call Idl.run() from the Connection thread. Idl.run() asserts
"not self.txn" and within that run() call is where notify() is
called. RowEventHandler's notify is called which queues the event
to be processed in it's own processing thread. This means that
when we get around to calling the event's run() in the other thread,
we could be processing a transaction, which could change what values
we access on the Row objects.

This removes the RowEventHandler thread which means that
notifications are handled in the Connection thread. Since some
events themselves create new transactions in their run() methods,
we can't run those inside Idl.run() without making Idl.run()
recursive and causing issues. So the notification is still queued
like it was in the previous version, and after we call Idl.run(),
we call RowEventHandler's notify_run() to dequeue the notification
and process it.

Change-Id: I59409f8ec1d8a59f94818abd3e3065c824df7b93
'}]
commit_message:
WIP Remove eventhandler thread

For now, just looking at how tests react to this.

We call Idl.run() from the Connection thread. Idl.run() asserts
"not self.txn" and within that run() call is where notify() is
called. RowEventHandler's notify is called which queues the event
to be processed in it's own processing thread. This means that
when we get around to calling the event's run() in the other thread,
we could be processing a transaction, which could change what values
we access on the Row objects.

This removes the RowEventHandler thread which means that
notifications are handled in the Connection thread. Since some
events themselves create new transactions in their run() methods,
we can't run those inside Idl.run() without making Idl.run()
recursive and causing issues. So the notification is still queued
like it was in the previous version, and after we call Idl.run(),
we call RowEventHandler's notify_run() to dequeue the notification
and process it.

Change-Id: I59409f8ec1d8a59f94818abd3e3065c824df7b93

[{'created': '2020-03-23 17:21:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix kolla-ansible stop with heterogeneous hosts

The 'kolla-ansible stop' command can be used to stop the services
running on hosts. However, if you run this command in an environment
with heterogeneous nodes (most real world scenarios have at least
control/compute), then it fails. This is because it only checks
whether a container is enabled, and not whether the host is in the
correct group. For example, it fails with nova-libvirt:

    Issue: No such container: nova_libvirt to stop.

This change fixes the issue by only attempting to stop containers on
hosts to which they are mapped.

Closes-Bug: #1868596

commit_message:
Fix kolla-ansible stop with heterogeneous hosts

The 'kolla-ansible stop' command can be used to stop the services
running on hosts. However, if you run this command in an environment
with heterogeneous nodes (most real world scenarios have at least
control/compute), then it fails. This is because it only checks
whether a container is enabled, and not whether the host is in the
correct group. For example, it fails with nova-libvirt:

    No such container: nova_libvirt to stop.

This change fixes the issue by only attempting to stop containers on
hosts to which they are mapped.

Change-Id: Ibecac60d1417269bbe25a280996ca9de6e6d018f
Closes-Bug: #1868596

commit_message:
Avoid circular reference during serialization

When an instance with numa topology is re-scheduled the conductor
migrate task blows with circular reference during request spec
serialization. It happens because there are ovos in the request spec
that jsonutils.dumps only serialize if requested explicitly.

This patch makes the explicit request.

This is a stable only bug fix as the borken code was removed in Stein by
the feature patch I4244f7dd8fe74565180f73684678027067b4506e

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/conductor/tasks/test_migrate.py
The unit test case was re-implemented the test refactoring in
I57568e9a01664ee373ea00a8db3164109c982909 is missing from pike.

Closes-Bug: #1864665

Change-Id: I1942bfa9bd1baf8738d34c287216db7b59000a36
(cherry picked from commit 3871b38fe03aee7a1ffbbdfdf8a60b8c09e0ba76)
(cherry picked from commit 54ca5d9afb11867ea022464d7ecad9f1ce13e453)

commit_message:
Mask the token used to allow access to consoles

Hide the novncproxy token from the logs.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/unit/consoleauth/test_consoleauth.py
NOTE: conflict is due to Iffdd4e251bfa2bac1bfd49498e32b738843709de is 
only backported till Queens.

Co-Authored-By:paul-carlton2 <paul.carlton2@hp.com>
Co-Authored-By:Tristan Cacqueray <tdecacqu@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Allow support for Keymaster and encryption middleware

With this patch will allow users to configure object encryption
at storage level also on http headers some AWSV4 S3 Clients
enforce the encryption support.

Change-Id: I50921b098d9143dc29c55b1ea24cddfa4dc7f870
Closes-Bug: #1868912

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-25 09:44:09.000000000', 'message': 'Add tempest_tempest_conf_overrides from featureset into jobs vars

As described in related-bug the values in the FS are dropped when
this is defined in the job vars. This moves them from the FS into
the job definitions that override it.

Change-Id: I400291d4752baf055f26b7d66dd96307763748e4
Related-Bug: 1868938
'}]
commit_message:
Add tempest_tempest_conf_overrides from featureset into jobs vars

As described in related-bug the values in the FS are dropped when
this is defined in the job vars. This moves them from the FS into
the job definitions that override it.

Change-Id: I400291d4752baf055f26b7d66dd96307763748e4
Related-Bug: 1868938

commit_message:
Complete switch from glanceclient to SDK for image service

In https://review.opendev.org/#/c/650374/ a work has been started to
switch image service support from glanceclient with all it's
dependencies to the SDK version. With this change version 1 (anyway
deprecated since ages) is also being switched to SDK.

Change-Id: Ic391500af02a73d81d64a9e9113cca85c9e24390

we don't want to move things in this direction. we should be relying on ansible to figure out the right value instead of Heat.

that way, we can make changes to the value by just adding/removing hosts from the ansible inventory. See:

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/tripleo-specs/specs/ussuri/scaling-with-ansible-inventory.html

This is why we are moving these sorts of tasks into ansible to begin with. We need to be relying more on Ansible, less on Heat.

If we can remove the value from global_vars, I'd look into that approach instead if you want to address the duplication."}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2020-03-25 13:32:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2020-03-25 13:38:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

> we don't want to move things in this direction. we should be

 > 
 > If we can remove the value from global_vars, I'd look into that
 > approach instead if you want to address the duplication.

I guess the commit message is a bit misleading.
This is really about closing a bug.

We have two options:
 a) merge this, backport it to train to close of the issues in the stable release. Then propose a patch restoring the rendering in ansible.
 b) Abandon this and fix the bug's in ansible, and backport that.

Another thing to consider is that the security team is working on adding DNS entries in FreeIPA. They are afik using the 'hosts_entry' in the inventory since this allow them to not duplicating the work."}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2020-03-25 14:04:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Do you mean the hosts_entry in global_vars.yaml? It would be nice to avoid that. commit_message:
Less is More - hosts entries

Use the 'hosts_entry' in global_vars instead of
re-rendering the same thing in ansible.

Closes-Bug: #1868588
Change-Id: Ic75bbd0a2011925d106816ba88f1bcded405f22e

commit_message:
Clean up pecan.abort utils

This trys to clean up unneeded utils:

* get_resource raises HttpNotFound directly instead of
  returning an empty value.
* pecan.abort will never be executed in the get_xx utils.

Change-Id: Ie98586bce8fe5e4acdaffa9c3dcb75b157237118

commit_message:
Drop pyscss2 and django-pyscss2

pyscss is now maintained again and a new version commpatible with setuptools 46
has been released. Once a new horizon release is shipped, horizon plugins do not
need to install pyscss2 (and django-pyscss2), so pyscss2 and django-pyscss2
will be unnecessary.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/714826
Change-Id: I111fb609751b8724248a85fe9adf004ae3c4e634

[{'created': '2020-03-25 01:59:06.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] Pin neutron-tempest-plugin to 0.9.0

manila's IPv6 jobs setup bgp with the help of
neutron-dynamic-routing. The jobs enable
neutron-dynamic-routing using its devstack
plugin to install it alongside openstack/neutron.

neutron-tempest-plugin is a "branchless" tempest
plugin to the neutron project. We don't need to
install or run this tempest plugin in manila test
jobs. However, it is imported by test code within
the neutron-dynamic-routing project, forcing us to
include it in the list of requirements for the IPv6
jobs.

neutron-tempest-plugin dropped support for python3
in ussuri. python3 only code was added to
neutron-tempest-plugin causing failures in the
voting ipv6 lvm test job
(manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm).

So, pin the version of neutron-tempest-plugin we're
pulling in to a tagged git ref when the plugin last
supported python2.

Change-Id: I82854d0f9075e6fc7d33c6459d71d7f0d502ff3c
Closes-Bug: #1868905
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2020-03-25 02:01:49.000000000', 'message': '[stable-only] Pin neutron-tempest-plugin to 0.9.0

commit_message:
[stable-only] Pin neutron-tempest-plugin to 0.9.0

manila's IPv6 jobs setup bgp with the help of
neutron-dynamic-routing. The jobs enable
neutron-dynamic-routing using its devstack
plugin to install it alongside openstack/neutron.

neutron-tempest-plugin is a "branchless" tempest
plugin to the neutron project. We don't need to
install or run this tempest plugin in manila test
jobs. However, it is imported by test code within
the neutron-dynamic-routing project, forcing us to
include it in the list of requirements for the IPv6
jobs.

neutron-tempest-plugin dropped support for python3
in ussuri. python3 only code was added to
neutron-tempest-plugin causing failures in the
voting ipv6 lvm test job
(manila-tempest-minimal-dsvm-lvm).

So, pin the version of neutron-tempest-plugin we're
pulling in to a tagged git ref when the plugin last
supported python2.

Change-Id: I82854d0f9075e6fc7d33c6459d71d7f0d502ff3c
Closes-Bug: #1868905
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

im kind of neutral on this.

i am not sure is see a case where a non admin can do something
actionable with the fault details to allow whatever action they were trying to succeed other then filing a ticket with the could admin.

so im not sure this is a useful exetention to the api but i also see that it could give piece of mind to an end user because they might know why its went to error but equally frustrate them if they cant fix it.

so as i said i dont really think this is useful for a non adming.
for an admin sure but non admin i dont think so. that said i dont think its particallrly harmful although i also wonder if this is somthing we would want a policy rule for so that an operator could decide if they want to expose it or not.'}, {'account_id': 26458, 'date': '2020-01-13 07:27:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
CentOS 8: Drop trickle install to build freezer

Trickle was previously installed from EPEL7, but is not available in
EPEL8. It does not appear critical to the functioning of freezer, so
drop it to allow freezer images to build for CentOS 8.

Change-Id: I3e12ab51e9f01d383268d75ce72903686564ada6
Partially-Implements: blueprint centos-rhel-8

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

charm repos need few updates on either py2 drop or updating
ussuri python template.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Idc21ab05c20d63a9e6252b16a73cbf970ca770e7

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-19 18:42:49.000000000', 'message': 'nova-live-migration: Ensure subnode is fenced during evacuation testing

As stated in the forced-down API [1]:

> Setting a service forced down without completely fencing it will
> likely result in the corruption of VMs on that host.

Previously only the libvirtd service was stopped on the subnode prior to
calling this API, allowing n-cpu, q-agt and the underlying guest domains
to continue running on the host.

This change now ensures all devstack services are stopped on the subnode
and all active domains destroyed.

It is hoped that this will resolve bug #1813789 where evacuations have
timed out due to VIF plugging issues on the new destination host.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=update-forced-down-detail#update-forced-down

Related-Bug: #1813789
Change-Id: I8af2ad741ca08c3d88efb9aa817c4d1470491a23
(cherry picked from commit b097959c1cbc9af1d90c7502286bc3e20972201f)
'}, {'created': '2020-03-23 10:22:01.000000000', 'message': 'nova-live-migration: Ensure subnode is fenced during evacuation testing

As stated in the forced-down API [1]:

> Setting a service forced down without completely fencing it will
> likely result in the corruption of VMs on that host.

Previously only the libvirtd service was stopped on the subnode prior to
calling this API, allowing n-cpu, q-agt and the underlying guest domains
to continue running on the host.

This change now ensures all devstack services are stopped on the subnode
and all active domains destroyed.

It is hoped that this will resolve bug #1813789 where evacuations have
timed out due to VIF plugging issues on the new destination host.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=update-forced-down-detail#update-forced-down

NOTE(lyarwood): The following change is squashed here to allow both to
pass the gate without encoutering additional failures.

nova-live-migration: Only stop n-cpu and q-agt during evacuation testing

I8af2ad741ca08c3d88efb9aa817c4d1470491a23 started to correctly fence the
subnode ahead of evacuation testing but missed that c-vol and g-api
where also running on the host. As a result the BFV evacuation test will
fail if the volume being used is created on the c-vol backend hosted on
the subnode.

This change now avoids this by limiting the services stopped ahead of
the evacuation on the subnode to n-cpu and q-agt.

Change-Id: Ia7c317e373e4037495d379d06eda19a71412d409
Closes-Bug: #1868234

(cherry picked from commit b097959c1cbc9af1d90c7502286bc3e20972201f)
'}]
commit_message:
nova-live-migration: Ensure subnode is fenced during evacuation testing

As stated in the forced-down API [1]:

> Setting a service forced down without completely fencing it will
> likely result in the corruption of VMs on that host.

Previously only the libvirtd service was stopped on the subnode prior to
calling this API, allowing n-cpu, q-agt and the underlying guest domains
to continue running on the host.

This change now ensures all devstack services are stopped on the subnode
and all active domains destroyed.

It is hoped that this will resolve bug #1813789 where evacuations have
timed out due to VIF plugging issues on the new destination host.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/?expanded=update-forced-down-detail#update-forced-down

NOTE(lyarwood): The following change is squashed here to allow both to
pass the gate without encoutering additional failures.

nova-live-migration: Only stop n-cpu and q-agt during evacuation testing

I8af2ad741ca08c3d88efb9aa817c4d1470491a23 started to correctly fence the
subnode ahead of evacuation testing but missed that c-vol and g-api
where also running on the host. As a result the BFV evacuation test will
fail if the volume being used is created on the c-vol backend hosted on
the subnode.

This change now avoids this by limiting the services stopped ahead of
the evacuation on the subnode to n-cpu and q-agt.

Change-Id: Ia7c317e373e4037495d379d06eda19a71412d409
Closes-Bug: #1868234
(cherry picked from commit 1e16b3184d4e298c454ede7c56040f6d70276a0c)

Related-Bug: #1813789
Change-Id: I8af2ad741ca08c3d88efb9aa817c4d1470491a23
(cherry picked from commit b097959c1cbc9af1d90c7502286bc3e20972201f)

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-05 20:45:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

Here is the error that I currently work on.

I don't think we need to continue to manage the `deaduntil` things because pymemcache introduced the `_safely_run_func` which is called each time  a memcache command is called on client and so this function will automatically drop the client if is dead.

I currently work to refactor this part and keep the pool properly synced with available servers.

```'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-09 10:08:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

I did some tests with https://github.com/4383/oslo.labs which helped me to test hot libraries switching, and I think that  `deaduntil` stuffs are only needed by python-memcached, I mean this code is here only to manage properly dead hosts where the library seems to need help to drop properly the hosts. 

Pymemcache is battery included on this point and each time we call a memcached command the library will drop dead host automatically.

I need to do more tests with threads included in my scenario to mesure the possible impacts and changes and trace things. I hop that Wednesday I will have a good big picture.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-10 16:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-10 16:36:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

I refactored all the commits to:
1. revert broken changes and fix the issue [1];
2. introduce CI backend job [2];
3. fixing and reintroducing the previously reverted changes (point 1 and [1]) through a new backend to allow us smooth migration [3].

So the backend based on python-memcached is reintroduced as the default backend, and a new one is now available to allow to migrate toward a more modern client (pymemcache), and allow us to drop eventlet here. 

I -W to let's us time to discute about this scenario etc...

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711439/2
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711422/9
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711220/16"}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-10 17:34:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-11 15:16:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11: Patch Set 10 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-03-24 18:04:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Patch Set 11 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-03-25 10:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Workflow+1'}]

This is to be able to validate in CI that it actually works.

dnm for now, reverting to test it in CI in https://review.opendev.org/711422'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-10 16:27:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2020-03-10 16:36:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

I refactored all the commits to:
1. revert broken changes and fix the issue [1];
2. introduce CI backend job [2];
3. fixing and reintroducing the previously reverted changes (point 1 and [1]) through a new backend to allow us smooth migration [3].

So the backend based on python-memcached is reintroduced as the default backend, and a new one is now available to allow to migrate toward a more modern client (pymemcache), and allow us to drop eventlet here. 

I -W to let's us time to discute about this scenario etc...

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711439/2
[2] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711422/9
[3] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711220/16"}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-03-10 17:25:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Revert "Switch from python-memcached to pymemcache."

pymemcache turned out to be far from drop-in replacement.
It will be reintroduced as another backend. See [1].

Closes-bug: #1866008
Related-bug: #1812935

This reverts commit 8a8248d764bbb1db6c0089a58745803c03e38fdb.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/711220

Co-Authored-By: Herv Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ia3b8d42435b0eac1c87b866449b08a1d11818986

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-04 09:29:29.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Default to TLS for OVN-enabled tests

OVN makes use of TLS for authorization and authentication of its
peers and it does not really make sense to deploy without it.

Let's reflect this fact in the functional tests.

TODO:
- Evaluate whether success of existing functional tests with TLS
  enabled for OVN is enough in itself or if additional TLS
  specific validation is required.

Change-Id: Ibaec2043a45c52cffba0a5ca376eaa453e62df5a
Related-Bug: #1847032
Related-Bug: #1850160
"}, {'created': '2020-01-04 16:08:26.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Default to TLS for OVN-enabled tests

peers and it does not really make sense to deploy without it.

commit_message:
[OVN] Default to TLS for OVN-enabled tests

OVN makes use of TLS for authorization and authentication of its
peers and it does not really make sense to deploy without it.

Let's reflect this fact in the functional tests.

Change-Id: Ibaec2043a45c52cffba0a5ca376eaa453e62df5a
Related-Bug: #1847032
Related-Bug: #1850160

Avoid failure caused by installation of mox3==1.0.0 on unsupported
platforms.

subject: Bring ansible verbosity to 2 on collect-logs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9592, 'name': 'wes hayutin', 'email': 'whayutin@redhat.com', 'username': 'weshayutin'}, {'_account_id': 9976, 'name': 'Ronelle Landy', 'email': 'rlandy@redhat.com', 'username': 'rlandy'}, {'_account_id': 10022, 'name': 'Gabriele Cerami', 'email': 'gcerami@redhat.com', 'username': 'panda'}, {'_account_id': 10969, 'name': 'Shnaidman Sagi (Sergey)', 'display_name': 'Shnaidman Sagi', 'email': 'sshnaidm@redhat.com', 'username': 'sergsh'}, {'_account_id': 12393, 'name': 'chandan kumar', 'display_name': 'Chandan Kumar', 'email': 'chkumar@redhat.com', 'username': 'chkumar246'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-01-30 16:27:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-01-30 16:49:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

It's done intentionally for debugging issues that we can miss in regular non-verbose run."}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-01-30 16:53:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

where is the 450MB log file?'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-01-30 17:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-01-30 17:01:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Example of the 405MB collect logs file
http://logs.rdoproject.org/86/703586/12/openstack-check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-ovb-1ctlr_1comp-featureset001/398d3d2/logs/quickstart_collect_logs.log

IMHO I can't read that .. let's move to -vv from -vvvv"}, {'account_id': 9592, 'date': '2020-01-30 17:10:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-2

leave it as is.. ovb jobs and a few others require this level of verbosity.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-01-30 17:13:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Perhaps make it configurable so only ovb does it?'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-02-02 09:58:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-02-02 11:23:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-2'}, {'account_id': 12393, 'date': '2020-02-03 08:56:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

From git blame https://github.com/openstack/tripleo-ci/commit/8d117bb228c8a79f4c67375a1f990239fa718cd3 -vvvv was added to debug the issue and the bug is related to https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1810054 
(multinode jobs failing on gathering facts from subnode-2 ) which was failing on specific provider to debug the issue.

I think it is not the case now, we can move to back to vv.'}, {'account_id': 24162, 'date': '2020-03-25 11:35:52.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

I fully disagree with that default verbosity level but based on the votes received it makes sense to abandon it.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-30 16:27:31.000000000', 'message': 'Bring ansible verbosity to 2 on collect-logs

Previous value caused a 450MB log file on at least one change. Anything
above -vv should only be used for debugging and not merged.

Included note to warn about the risks.

Change-Id: Iebde955de8f51696cedb30623ad24cb81c0987a5
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703586/
'}, {'created': '2020-02-02 09:58:40.000000000', 'message': 'Bring ansible verbosity to 2 on collect-logs

Previous value caused a 450MB log file on at least one change. Anything
above -vv should only be used for debugging and not merged.

Included note to warn about the risks.

Change-Id: Iebde955de8f51696cedb30623ad24cb81c0987a5
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703586/
'}]
commit_message:
Bring ansible verbosity to 2 on collect-logs

Previous value caused a 450MB log file on at least one change. Anything
above -vv should only be used for debugging and not merged.

Included note to warn about the risks.

Change-Id: Iebde955de8f51696cedb30623ad24cb81c0987a5
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/703586/

commit_message:
Forwards LOGOUT_URL to templates.

Uses the openstack context preprocessor to pass
the LOGOUT_URL from settings to templates and
changes the 'Sign out' menu entry to redirect to it
instead of the logout view directly.

closes-bug: #1747149
Change-Id: Id17ffca6b5e24779433c3f19d009bb2a77f7b901

commit_message:
[trivial] Fix comment for Software RAID restart

The detection of the holder disks was moved elsewhere,
so the comment is misleading now.

Change-Id: If41b4270ab8fb1626979ca17134764e088e3cb65

[{'created': '2019-12-19 21:36:42.000000000', 'message': 'pike-only: remove broken non-voting ceph jobs

The ceph job is broken on pike and the dependent
fix in devstack [1] has not gotten attention after
several months.

Since pike is in extended maintenance mode, the job
is non-voting even if it were working, and there does
not seem to be much desire in making this work again
(it would still be non-voting and could easily break
again), we might as well just remove it from pike
testing.

Related mailing list thread: [2]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/684756/
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011632.html

Change-Id: I9e153f86c81ed6d9f8d9682b66d6d5c7f7b25296
Closes-Bug: #1835627

commit_message:
pike-only: remove broken non-voting ceph jobs

The ceph job is broken on pike and the dependent
fix in devstack [1] has not gotten attention after
several months.

Since pike is in extended maintenance mode, the job
is non-voting even if it were working, and there does
not seem to be much desire in making this work again
(it would still be non-voting and could easily break
again), we might as well just remove it from pike
testing.

Related mailing list thread: [2]

[1] https://review.opendev.org/684756/
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-December/011632.html

Change-Id: I9e153f86c81ed6d9f8d9682b66d6d5c7f7b25296
Closes-Bug: #1835627

commit_message:
Release horizon 18.2.0 (ussuri)

pyscss is now maintained by support of horizon team so we can move back to
pyscss from pyscss2 (fork). It looks better to cut a new release of horizon
to avoid pyscss2 usage including lower-constraints in horizon plugins.

commit_message:
Fix idempotency for os-lxc-container-setup.yml

Added regexp to avoid multiple entry of lxc.start.order in
os-lxc-container-setup.yml. Remove insertafter to avoid
confusion.

Change-Id: I50ea0ba97c79f9c1509e382643b9aecc805862b7
Closes-Bug: 1862625
(cherry picked from commit 4d9b568f6c772269a95811c5f4e8c4b87eff4702)

commit_message:
Remove excess physnet to device mapping

Since sriov binding driver uses pod resource
service and compute particular virtual function
which was returned by pod resource service, there
is no need to have physycal_device_mapping.

Also this commit fixes documentation and
adds release note regarding physical_device_mapping removal.

Change-Id: Ibf793b78727da40283b6221c6df0da969bf5e829
Signed-off-by: Danil Golov <d.golov@samsung.com>

[{'created': '2020-03-24 15:50:30.000000000', 'message': 'Run on_finalize() for ADDED events

In case of Kuryr being restarted when a resource is already deleted, an
ADDED event will be detected by the handler. If that resource had
finalizers, Kuryr needs to run on_finalize() too. This commit makes sure
we check for deletionTimestamp on ADDED events too.

Change-Id: Ia98311a4afc840b3db87f02555a45e9e639ce742
'}]
commit_message:
Run on_finalize() for ADDED events

In case of Kuryr being restarted when a resource is already deleted, an
ADDED event will be detected by the handler. If that resource had
finalizers, Kuryr needs to run on_finalize() too. This commit makes sure
we check for deletionTimestamp on ADDED events too.

Change-Id: Ia98311a4afc840b3db87f02555a45e9e639ce742

commit_message:
Add Octavia OVN Provider configuration (1 of 2)

This patch enhances Octavia's OVN driver config, so it can connect to
OVN_Northbound DB using TLS.

This is part 1 of 2, where octavia::api::ovn_nb_connection will move
to newly created octavia::provider::ovn::ovn_nb_connection config file.
But that has to be split into 2 parts to avoid breaking the
CI until the THT+pupple-tripleo changes merges [1].

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:bug/1861886+(status:open+OR+status:merged)

Co-Authored-By: Brent Eagles <beagles@redhat.com>
Related-Bug: #1861886
Change-Id: Id74ef39ff303c9abf8118df203970cd871ed974a

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696834/
Change-Id: I01fea878fe1965768b1e569e7d9a672c88185fb7
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Test RBD swap_volume

Introduce a Fedora latest based job with the virt-preview repo enabled
to test swapping RBD volumes.

This change will be repurposed later to introduce these jobs to the
experimental queue for the devstack-plugin-ceph project.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/696834/
Change-Id: I01fea878fe1965768b1e569e7d9a672c88185fb7

commit_message:
Register DNSMASQ_OPTS in functional sanity tests

test_dnsmasq_version() is sometimes triggering a traceback
because the new dnsmasq_enable_addr6_list config option isn't
being found. Register the option in the test class.

Change-Id: Ie441f831bcd0835ae8e1cd082005640b65b7393a
Closes-bug: #1866129
(cherry picked from commit cc281afeecc58e48f0d5bf3a5d6588e96e1fd33f)

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-02-04 21:05:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-02-04 21:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-02-04 21:52:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-02-04 21:52:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-02-05 01:40:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

The script that fails [1] is generated by the tripleo-ansible role tripleo_ceph_run_ansible [2]. You can see in the generated script [3] that the following environment variable is set:

 SUDO_COMMAND=/bin/sh -c echo BECOME-SUCCESS-absoeucktxpqbohexiwnnaooumjifuvk ;

I suspect that getting the above quoted so that it becomes:

 SUDO_COMMAND="/bin/sh -c echo BECOME-SUCCESS-absoeucktxpqbohexiwnnaooumjifuvk ;"

Might help. 

The shell script normally runs like this:

 ANSIBLE_CONFIG=/whatever ... ANSIBLE_FORKS=25 ansible-playbook ...

The SUDO_COMMAND is jammed into the middle causing a parsing error. When config-download ansible calls ceph-ansible it inherits the config-download ansible environment variables as per:

 https://review.opendev.org/#/c/674706/

An alternative attempting to quote is to override the following to false:

 ceph_ansible_inherits_calling_ansible_environment

ceph-ansible was installing ceph before 674706 was introduced so you don't technically need it to make scenario001 pass.


[1] https://storage.bhs.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_7b9/705775/3/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-standalone/7b9a60c/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_deploy.log

[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible/src/branch/master/tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo_ceph_run_ansible/tasks/main.yml#L52

[3] https://storage.bhs.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_7b9/705775/3/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario001-standalone/7b9a60c/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/standalone-ansible-CMR4oB/ceph-ansible/'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-02-05 15:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I opened a bug for your issue. I hope the workaround (ceph_ansible_inherits_calling_ansible_environment=false) allows you to keep moving in the meantime:

 https://bugs.launchpad.net/tripleo/+bug/1862031'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2020-02-05 16:56:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2020-02-05 16:57:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

commit_message:
Pick stale amphora randomly

Avoid getting the same amphora all the time if its loadbalancer
stuck in PENDING state and could not be failovered.

Story: 2007340
Task: 38877

Change-Id: I2f680a00be695c3828166e6803882765af79b79e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-24 08:10:20.000000000', 'message': 'Clear lsp.addresses always if port is OVN LB VIP port.

The check _is_virtual_port_supported() prevented us from
clearing the addresses field while port was OVN LB VIP port.
The virtual port should be set only when port is Octavia Amphorae
VIP port.

Cherry-picked from neutron: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708360/

Change-Id: Id6dd29650951855d13498a7206f6d1dde7db7864
Closes-Bug: 1863893
(cherry picked from commit 9bd97242b65b56ee89c422b56af05a330ad3c521)
'}]
commit_message:
Clear lsp.addresses always if port is OVN LB VIP port.

The check _is_virtual_port_supported() prevented us from
clearing the addresses field while port was OVN LB VIP port.
The virtual port should be set only when port is Octavia Amphorae
VIP port.

Cherry-picked from neutron: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708360/

Change-Id: Id6dd29650951855d13498a7206f6d1dde7db7864
Closes-Bug: 1863893
(cherry picked from commit 9bd97242b65b56ee89c422b56af05a330ad3c521)

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

charm repos need few updates on either py2 drop or updating
ussuri python template, tox.ini etc.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714728/

Change-Id: I2bcf1208d75d8cdda4e3892b3e48c85eaf5db8d1

commit_message:
Update the badge shown in galaxy

Galaxy shows the README, which currently shows a "failing" badge
pointing at github actions. That's obviously not right for us.

Update this by using the zuul:gated badge and pointing to the
builds for the repo in the Zuul Dashboard.

Change-Id: I7f1254f882486514cd29a52bf05ebf5a972da490

[{'created': '2020-03-12 20:16:43.000000000', 'message': "Exclude repo_build_global_links_path from sync

These files are only used by the repo_build during wheel requirements
and should only be needed and used on the repo_container they're on.

When you're transitioning from one distribution release to another,
e.g. xenial -> bionic, syncing the links directory between these
repo_containers can break the wheel building in weird ways.

Depends-on: I3bd6d3d987e32ee11c5f1fcb5c1b4b0fc797e7f9
Change-Id: Iaa2e52b26ba89802e06665ebe43fdf18e515abd7
"}]
commit_message:
Exclude repo_build_global_links_path from sync

These files are only used by the repo_build during wheel requirements
and should only be needed and used on the repo_container they're on.

When you're transitioning from one distribution release to another,
e.g. xenial -> bionic, syncing the links directory between these
repo_containers can break the wheel building in weird ways.

Depends-on: I3bd6d3d987e32ee11c5f1fcb5c1b4b0fc797e7f9
Change-Id: Iaa2e52b26ba89802e06665ebe43fdf18e515abd7

subject: DNM --- [ci] Stop requiring neutron-tempest-plugin
messages:
[{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-03-24 22:27:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21863, 'date': '2020-03-24 22:55:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Build failed.  To recheck use 'run-INFINIDAT'.  For 3rd party ci contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems

- dsvm-tempest-infinibox-nfs http://openstack-ci-logs.aws.infinidat.com/85/714785/1/check/dsvm-tempest-infinibox-nfs/cf70e5a : FAILURE in 27m 36s"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-03-25 05:19:08.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

Can't remove this yet, see https://review.opendev.org/#/c/714806/ for the approach taken"}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-24 22:27:04.000000000', 'message': "DNM --- [ci] Stop requiring neutron-tempest-plugin

We needed this plugin because neutron-dynamic-plugin's
code base included its tempest plugin in-tree. This
issue was addressed in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695014/.

So we no longer need to install neutron-tempest-plugin
in manila jobs.

Change-Id: I34b77c95aad7ee2b67ba876db8aa64bbc44adb79
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>
"}]
commit_message:
DNM --- [ci] Stop requiring neutron-tempest-plugin

We needed this plugin because neutron-dynamic-plugin's
code base included its tempest plugin in-tree. This
issue was addressed in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/695014/.

So we no longer need to install neutron-tempest-plugin
in manila jobs.

Change-Id: I34b77c95aad7ee2b67ba876db8aa64bbc44adb79
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-02 14:51:32.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Provide the backing file format when creating qcow2 disks

Libvirt v6.0.0 [1] will now fail to launch a domain when using qcow2
disks where the backing file format is not recorded in the qcow2
metadata.

There are some discussions upstream around relaxing this slightly [2]
but for now any attempt to launch an instance using qcow2 disks will
fail as Nova does not populate this value when creating the disk.

Nova needs to at a minimum start populating this field and depending on
the outcome of the thread upstream in Libvirt also potentially handle
the upgrade case where we may need to rebase existing disks in order to
update the metadata.

For now this change simply adds the backing_fmt option to the qemu-img
command line used to create these disks.

[1] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/3615e8b39badf2a526996a69dc91a92b04cf262e
[2] https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2020-February/msg00616.html

Partial-Bug: #1864020
Change-Id: I77ebada015f6522a300be4fa043fb8676458402b
(cherry picked from commit 0cfe9c81e3fe4d268c9949c6b8e873abab94a407)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Provide the backing file format when creating qcow2 disks

Libvirt v6.0.0 [1] will now fail to launch a domain when using qcow2
disks where the backing file format is not recorded in the qcow2
metadata.

There are some discussions upstream around relaxing this slightly [2]
but for now any attempt to launch an instance using qcow2 disks will
fail as Nova does not populate this value when creating the disk.

Nova needs to at a minimum start populating this field and depending on
the outcome of the thread upstream in Libvirt also potentially handle
the upgrade case where we may need to rebase existing disks in order to
update the metadata.

For now this change simply adds the backing_fmt option to the qemu-img
command line used to create these disks.

[1] https://github.com/libvirt/libvirt/commit/3615e8b39badf2a526996a69dc91a92b04cf262e
[2] https://www.redhat.com/archives/libvir-list/2020-February/msg00616.html

Partial-Bug: #1864020
Change-Id: I77ebada015f6522a300be4fa043fb8676458402b
(cherry picked from commit 0cfe9c81e3fe4d268c9949c6b8e873abab94a407)

Add new license scheme for Flashsystem9000 series

With this change, cinder driver can create compressed volume on DRP.

Closes-bug: #1863578

commit_message:
clear_foreign_config() succeeds if no foreign disk

When clear_foreign_config() does not detect a foreign disk, instead
of failing and raising an exception, it succeeds and returns a value
which informs the caller nothing further needs to be done.

Change-Id: I4cea95659db11747b1c8708e1dbe7cac53c0eaf9
(cherry picked from commit 8eec25c00d208c19dceb266c74c7bc4811ba6076)

commit_message:
clear_foreign_config() succeeds if no foreign disk

When clear_foreign_config() does not detect a foreign disk, instead
of failing and raising an exception, it succeeds and returns a value
which informs the caller nothing further needs to be done.

Change-Id: I4cea95659db11747b1c8708e1dbe7cac53c0eaf9
(cherry picked from commit 8eec25c00d208c19dceb266c74c7bc4811ba6076)

commit_message:
Fix Horizon to work with the latest pyScss

pyScss v1.3.5 implements 'function-exists' function now. It breaks
MaterialDesign-Webfont [1] which is provided by xstatic-mdi package.

This patch re-implements FontAwesome-based styles for Material theme to
not use MaterialDesign-Webfont classes.

Another advantage of this improvement is we can use the latest pyScss
(once it'll be released) and update xstatic-mdi too.

[1] https://github.com/Templarian/MaterialDesign-Webfont/issues/19

Closes-Bug: #1771559
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/714450
Change-Id: Ia9e1e807591d4428f585177f521d4cb9d463b917

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-14 16:52:10.000000000', 'message': 'rt: only map compute node if we created it

If ComputeNode.create() fails, the update_available_resource
periodic will not try to create it again because it will be
mapped in the compute_nodes dict and _init_compute_node will
return early but trying to save changes to that ComputeNode
object later will fail because there is no id on the object,
since we failed to create it in the DB.

This simply reverses the logic such that we only map the
compute node if we successfully created it.

Some existing _init_compute_node testing had to be changed
since it relied on the order of when the ComputeNode object
is created and put into the compute_nodes dict in order
to pass the object along to some much lower-level PCI
tracker code, which was arguably mocking too deep for a unit
test. That is changed to avoid the low-level mocking and
assertions and just assert that _setup_pci_tracker is called
as expected.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict and slight test change is because
I120a98cc4c11772f24099081ef3ac44a50daf71d is not in Pike.

Change-Id: I9fa1d509a3de405d6246fb8670612c65c10cc93b
Closes-Bug: #1839674
(cherry picked from commit f578146f372386e1889561cba33e95495e66ce97)
(cherry picked from commit 648770bd6897aa2ec95df3ec55344d5803543f07)
(cherry picked from commit 35273a844ab2dc2494f0166d9b8228ee302acd4f)
(cherry picked from commit 6cc37953b3b80ccf32f36329c1b787c22beaf53a)
'}, {'created': '2019-08-14 16:55:03.000000000', 'message': 'rt: only map compute node if we created it

If ComputeNode.create() fails, the update_available_resource
periodic will not try to create it again because it will be
mapped in the compute_nodes dict and _init_compute_node will
return early but trying to save changes to that ComputeNode
object later will fail because there is no id on the object,
since we failed to create it in the DB.

This simply reverses the logic such that we only map the
compute node if we successfully created it.

Some existing _init_compute_node testing had to be changed
since it relied on the order of when the ComputeNode object
is created and put into the compute_nodes dict in order
to pass the object along to some much lower-level PCI
tracker code, which was arguably mocking too deep for a unit
test. That is changed to avoid the low-level mocking and
assertions and just assert that _setup_pci_tracker is called
as expected.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py

Some existing _init_compute_node testing had to be changed
since it relied on the order of when the ComputeNode object

commit_message:
rt: only map compute node if we created it

If ComputeNode.create() fails, the update_available_resource
periodic will not try to create it again because it will be
mapped in the compute_nodes dict and _init_compute_node will
return early but trying to save changes to that ComputeNode
object later will fail because there is no id on the object,
since we failed to create it in the DB.

This simply reverses the logic such that we only map the
compute node if we successfully created it.

Some existing _init_compute_node testing had to be changed
since it relied on the order of when the ComputeNode object
is created and put into the compute_nodes dict in order
to pass the object along to some much lower-level PCI
tracker code, which was arguably mocking too deep for a unit
test. That is changed to avoid the low-level mocking and
assertions and just assert that _setup_pci_tracker is called
as expected.

Conflicts:
      nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py

NOTE(mriedem): The conflict and slight change to test
test_compute_node_create_fail_retry_works is because
I120a98cc4c11772f24099081ef3ac44a50daf71d is not in Pike.

Change-Id: I9fa1d509a3de405d6246fb8670612c65c10cc93b
Closes-Bug: #1839674
(cherry picked from commit f578146f372386e1889561cba33e95495e66ce97)
(cherry picked from commit 648770bd6897aa2ec95df3ec55344d5803543f07)
(cherry picked from commit 35273a844ab2dc2494f0166d9b8228ee302acd4f)
(cherry picked from commit 5a3430983ab37aaed6bfc7ead0eb14121ffe69d3)

commit_message:
Add bulk creation of rules for Security Group.

With new method _bulk_create in OpenStackSDK, now it is possible to use
it for API methods, which supports creating multiple instances in single
call. Neutron supports couple of resources to be created at once. In
this change we propose to add multiple rules creation for a single
security group.

Change-Id: I5855a6faa706adeaf738a797af0048985bffe65f

When container <service>_restart_bundle is run, it checks whether
it can call pcs to restart the associated pacemaker resource, when

Make sure we enforce the checks in all cases (when we run during

Change-Id: I0367a657ddf440f0b73c4de5346306f12439db15
Closes-Bug: #1868533
(cherry picked from commit 4d21bab8f2c9380ccf6ff02971101dfcfb4655fb)
'}]
commit_message:
HA: check before restarting resource on stack update

When container <service>_restart_bundle is run, it checks whether
it can call pcs to restart the associated pacemaker resource, when
applicable.
Make sure we enforce the checks in all cases (when we run during
a stack update / update converge, and during a minor update).

Change-Id: I0367a657ddf440f0b73c4de5346306f12439db15
Closes-Bug: #1868533
(cherry picked from commit 4d21bab8f2c9380ccf6ff02971101dfcfb4655fb)

commit_message:
Fix flake8 tox.ini directive

Do not specify posargs on flake8 line in pep8 section, as it
breaks using 'tox -e pep8 HEAD~1' to check just code changed
in current change. While here change to match octavia tree
regarding enabled extensions.

Also fixed basepython warning now generated after removing
python2 code.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: Ifb5d9fc9d1833d954f4fedd9d8001dd0d5c2a113

commit_message:
Add mistral workflow module path to ansible-runner

This change extends the module path found within the the `package_update`
workflow so that we can ensure proper access to modules when ansible commands
are executed.

Change-Id: I6ce78e831b61791b60cbdd35a07cfc7367153d64
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2020-03-23 15:51:55.000000000', 'message': 'DCN/Edge: Handle ipv6 address for local glance endpoint

In a DCN/Edge deployment, the glance endpoint is overridden so that
nova and cinder use the local glance-api service. When the deployment
is using ipv6, ensure the endpoint URI has brackets around the ipv6
address.

Closes-Bug: #1868579
Change-Id: I8e71a1f6df732c352b018472c30c662f1e726aaa
'}]
commit_message:
DCN/Edge: Handle ipv6 address for local glance endpoint

In a DCN/Edge deployment, the glance endpoint is overridden so that
nova and cinder use the local glance-api service. When the deployment
is using ipv6, ensure the endpoint URI has brackets around the ipv6
address.

Closes-Bug: #1868579
Change-Id: I8e71a1f6df732c352b018472c30c662f1e726aaa

commit_message:
Use rpm -e instead of dnf for cleaning old kernels

If the running kernel of the system building the image
matches the kernel that is to be removed dnf will fail.

Repalce use use of dnf with rpm -e.

Closes-Bug: #1623409
Change-Id: Ie2481ea8a02b7b0720e46fa179f24badf4aa25c5

subject: Validate and cleanup capability config
messages:
[{'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-08-07 21:31:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 30722, 'date': '2019-08-08 04:20:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi, code looks like this:

cap_snap: True
run_snap_test: False 
-> error

cap_share_from_snap: True
run_snap_test: False
-> error

But shouldn't we also think about this case too?
cap_snap: False
run_snap_test: True

If backend has no snapshot support, running snapshot test will always failed."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-08-09 19:24:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-08-09 19:26:00.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> If backend has no snapshot support, running snapshot test will always failed.

Yes, that condition was being handled, but you're right - there's no value in supplying different values for capability_snapshot_support and run_snapshot_tests. I'd be happy if we got rid of all the capability flags... but that seems like a larger effort."}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2019-08-09 20:31:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Hmmm, this doesn't make tests fail - tempest swallows any exceptions and logs it in the log file: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/40fcb9ba283d36bad341d57356ed4276199d2ec4/tempest/test_discover/plugins.py#L202-L206"}, {'account_id': 30722, 'date': '2019-08-10 03:00:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

> Hmmm, this doesn't make tests fail - tempest swallows any
 > exceptions and logs it in the log file: https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/40fcb9ba283d36bad341d57356ed4276199d2ec4/tempest/test_discover/plugins.py#L202-L206

oh, i see. Thanks!"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-03-24 22:37:44.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Validate and cleanup capability config

- `capability_revert_to_snapshot_support` was deprecated
  and unused.
- Fail fast and early if using a mismatch of capability
  configuration options.

Change-Id: Ie58bc904a50da9a5541b8c956953526c45228fb3

commit_message:
Use py3 for CentOS

Unfortunatelly CentOS 7 do not have libvirt libraries
for py3, so isntead of symlinking them, we have to install devel package
and build them inside venv.

Change-Id: Ibcfb82f2b34c0f9db299262ed3b200f87953e043

subject: Fix faulthy state argument choice
messages: [{'account_id': 30547, 'date': '2019-12-19 08:52:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2020-03-23 17:37:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-03-24 19:55:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-12-19 08:52:53.000000000', 'message': "Fix faulthy state argument choice

The correct state name for a failing volume snapshot deletion is
'error_deleting' instead of 'error-deleting'. [1]

commit_message:
Fix faulthy state argument choice

The correct state name for a failing volume snapshot deletion is
'error_deleting' instead of 'error-deleting'. [1]

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/src/commit/89d6a5042fcb2ede5a0b1112d72fae805ea52fcd/cinder/objects/fields.py#L126

Task: #37844
Story: #2007037

Change-Id: Ia99900ece4f1cd29769b22ddaa3965789d719556

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-07 15:55:12.000000000', 'message': 'Use zuul cached repos for openstack services

In CI there are cached repos for the openstack services as well as
the OSA repos. We are currently using the cached repos for OSA ansible
roles, but not for the wider openstack services which are installed
from specific git repository SHA as defined by
playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_services.yml.

This patch parses the openstack_services.yml file and generates a
set of OSA override variables to use the locally cached git repos
instead of those at opendev.org. Network traffic is reduced and the
impact of OSA jobs on the opendev git servers is eased which has
caused problems when the proposal bot makes changes to all OSA repos
simultaneously.

Change-Id: I88087e3b4d6a688670e40165f127049956705801

commit_message:
Use zuul cached repos for openstack services

In CI there are cached repos for the openstack services as well as
the OSA repos. We are currently using the cached repos for OSA ansible
roles, but not for the wider openstack services which are installed
from specific git repository SHA as defined by
playbooks/defaults/repo_packages/openstack_services.yml.

This patch parses the openstack_services.yml file and generates a
set of OSA override variables to use the locally cached git repos
instead of those at opendev.org. Network traffic is reduced and the
impact of OSA jobs on the opendev git servers is eased which has
caused problems when the proposal bot makes changes to all OSA repos
simultaneously.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/712459
Change-Id: I88087e3b4d6a688670e40165f127049956705801

Jobs that inherit from base job don't always run unit tests or
use subunit. This post playbook will fail for them, so make subinit
role optional and set by default for true.

commit_message:
Run fetch-subunit-output role conditionally

Jobs that inherit from base job don't always run unit tests or
use subunit. This post playbook will fail for them, so make subinit
role optional and set by default for true.
For example disable it for ansible collection functional jobs:
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711471/
Change-Id: I50b1020c896d7d8a7d58e62de778bb8c2b6e970e

Charmhelpers sync for python38/focal support

This is just a charm-helpers sync so that the charm can run on focal to
support other charms going through focal enablement.  A further patch
will be supplied that enables the focal testing.

Change-Id: Ie744c1ff4c6651633d12dcd4de28d5e7a3e8646f

commit_message:
Insert hosts entries to the beginning of the file.

This ensures that the first host entry found for a host
will use what is generated by TripleO (if applicable).

Change-Id: I3a4883bc0c8dfa480ce5fd10ec40f3a9f0cff217
Closes-Bug: #1861035
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
(cherry picked from commit 76fd2eaacc202ab5681d23596ed0f3d25216bb9f)

commit_message:
Ensure that payload uses python3 for pre focal enablement

This patch is so that placement will run on focal.  This is not the
patchset that includes bundles and testing on focal.  Hence the
metadata.yaml is not updated to include focal.  That will come in a
subsequent patchset.

Change-Id: If43d096c6bd5c57d00d92c54bc0ce464ba50bfa1

commit_message:
Explicitly set ramdisk type

The virtualbmc-tempest-ironic-ipmi-iscsi job is based on
ironic-base job which will default to dib.
To prevent breaking the virtualbmc CI we set the ramdisk
type to tinyipa for now and we'll convert the jobs here later.

Change-Id: I0aaf3c8114de03c8eac00f885928fc4d85d4ac08

commit_message:
Explicitly set ramdisk type

The sushy-tools-tempest-ironic-partition-redfish-src job is based on
ironic-base job which will default to dib.
To prevent breaking the sushy-tools CI we set the ramdisk
type to tinyipa for now and we'll convert the jobs here later.

Change-Id: I15feaa53a505d2464b5d123ec8c670006ea03c61

[{'created': '2020-02-20 00:31:19.000000000', 'message': 'add CYBORG_MODE devstack option

This change extends the cyborg devstack
plugin to support 3 installation modes

contoller:
  installs both the cyborg api and conductor
compute:
  installs only the cyborg agent
all-in-one:
  installs all cyborg services, api, conductor
  and agent on a singel host. This is the default
  if CYBORG_MODE is not set.

This change moves all function definitions from
devstack/plugin.sh to devstack/lib/cyborg

Change-Id: Icb2d31eeed64ca935febef2402fcb60ba29cf2e5
'}]
commit_message:
add CYBORG_MODE devstack option

This change extends the cyborg devstack
plugin to support 3 installation modes

contoller:
  installs both the cyborg api and conductor
compute:
  installs only the cyborg agent
all-in-one:
  installs all cyborg services, api, conductor
  and agent on a singel host. This is the default
  if CYBORG_MODE is not set.

This change moves all function definitions from
devstack/plugin.sh to devstack/lib/cyborg

Change-Id: Icb2d31eeed64ca935febef2402fcb60ba29cf2e5

commit_message:
Exclude repo_build_global_links_path from sync

These files are (hopefully) only used by the repo_build and should
only be needed and used on the repo_container they're on. When
you're transitioning from one distribution release to another,
e.g. xenial -> bionic, syncing the links directory between these
repo_containers can break the wheel building in weird ways.

Also, switch to excluding repo_git_cache_dirname, seems only
relative paths should be used in the exclude statement. This
happened to go unnoticed since the directory was supposed to get
copied over by a secondary sync task anyways.

Depends-on: Ife4c1ab05e135930da8706d96af5b23648cee800
Depends-on: I4ae6737f1ded4cbb680a380c8c309a0f5bf64723
Change-Id: Iaa2e52b26ba89802e06665ebe43fdf18e515abd7

commit_message:
Remove Jeremy Stanley from election officials

I'm temporarily stepping down from my role as a technical election
official, as I will be participating in an upcoming election as a
candidate. I'll volunteer again after elections conclude, and am
also still available to assist with troubleshooting/fixing any
election tooling and automation.

Change-Id: Ieab6327d22a44d82e894fe50d24fe5d030284f14

commit_message:
Update gather-prom-metrics service selection

This change updates how the gather-prom-metrics playbook role
chooses which services and ports to scrape when gathering metrics
at the end of a zuul build.

We can hit more metric endpoints by finding services with a "metrics"
port, as not all applications have a service labeled "component=exporter"

Change-Id: Ib8db7ea2e7034063eefadad74828d0396407275b

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-24 12:49:11.000000000', 'message': "Honor endpoint override from config for volume

I'm guessing we should do this for everyone, but we have volume on
the brain right now. Rackspace is in the weird situation where
they do support v2 but only have v1 in the catalog (wut) So we
need to override the block-storage enpdoint by config. To do that,
we need to actually honor the config setting over here in OSC.

NOTE: We need to systemically overhaul how we're injesting config
over here - because there's too much variation. But we can leave
that for another day.

Story: 2007459
Task: 39137
Change-Id: Ifddf1ddd5abaa768ab18049c09d18bc269f3a4f5
"}]
commit_message:
Honor endpoint override from config for volume

I'm guessing we should do this for everyone, but we have volume on
the brain right now. Rackspace is in the weird situation where
they do support v2 but only have v1 in the catalog (wut) So we
need to override the block-storage enpdoint by config. To do that,
we need to actually honor the config setting over here in OSC.

NOTE: We need to systemically overhaul how we're injesting config
over here - because there's too much variation. But we can leave
that for another day.

Story: 2007459
Task: 39137
Change-Id: Ifddf1ddd5abaa768ab18049c09d18bc269f3a4f5

commit_message:
Add Oslo feature freeze to Victoria schedule

Oslo freezes earlier than other projects in order to give its
consumers time to consume any new features that are added before
their feature freezes.[0]

This adds that date to the release calendar so it is easy to find.

Change-Id: I19938bc16629754001f811e4ffe54c555c0833dc
0: https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/policy/feature-freeze.html

commit_message:
Do not compress log files before uploading

Log file compression is now not supported in the zuul log viewer.

Change-Id: I8738b28eb4f0fef314c751f67c7f361641128544
(cherry picked from commit df7fed2c56b13713b6e6f9cf08239fc43c97a674)

blocking to see if we ever get it in train (and then report back to neutron...)'}, {'account_id': 30491, 'date': '2020-03-24 18:11:25.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

does not seem happening - will restore if necessary'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-16 14:32:51.000000000', 'message': "CI: Ignore neutron-server CRITICAL about WSREP

We are getting this randomly on neutron-server shutdown
for upgrade.
As it does not affect real operations (and if it did,
we would definitely see it now), let's ignore it.

Change-Id: Ibe561517d44a1108e8223442a71fab36b69c2258
Related-bug: #1863579
(cherry picked from commit 16ade28d5f8df4da6b5ea5a508dbfb0aabe476c4)
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Ignore neutron-server CRITICAL about WSREP

We are getting this randomly on neutron-server shutdown
for upgrade.
As it does not affect real operations (and if it did,
we would definitely see it now), let's ignore it.

Change-Id: Ibe561517d44a1108e8223442a71fab36b69c2258
Related-bug: #1863579
(cherry picked from commit 16ade28d5f8df4da6b5ea5a508dbfb0aabe476c4)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-13 16:46:52.000000000', 'message': 'Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I5b6f25b1154b9d655843615ca8402fe4f73e923f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I5b6f25b1154b9d655843615ca8402fe4f73e923f
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
PowerMax Driver - SRDF Enhancement

This enhancement addresses changes in the PowerMax for Cinder
driver where all methods that require replication specific
functionality will use public Unisphere REST API endpoints.

Change-Id: Ic49a133b5ceb9013b4d53298e58ea2b21838870b

subject: Fix nested argument groups with ignore conflict handler
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-20 13:54:22.000000000', 'message': "Fix nested argument groups with ignore conflict handler

Cliff provides an additional conflict handler for argparse - 'ignore'.
To make this work it subclasses the argparse argument container classes
and adds a handle_conflict_ignore method. It also overrides the group
creation methods to return a subclassed argument group or mutually
exclusive argument group objects. This works, until you add a nested
argument group, at which point a standard argument group object is
returned which does not support the ignore conflict handler.

This change fixes the issue by returning subclassed group objects for
nested groups.

Change-Id: I517c61f24ba6194ff6181e115a3a23adbce3ea53
Story: 2005891
Task: 33749
"}]
commit_message:
Fix nested argument groups with ignore conflict handler

Cliff provides an additional conflict handler for argparse - 'ignore'.
To make this work it subclasses the argparse argument container classes
and adds a handle_conflict_ignore method. It also overrides the group
creation methods to return a subclassed argument group or mutually
exclusive argument group objects. This works, until you add a nested
argument group, at which point a standard argument group object is
returned which does not support the ignore conflict handler.

This change fixes the issue by returning subclassed group objects for
nested groups.

Change-Id: I517c61f24ba6194ff6181e115a3a23adbce3ea53
Story: 2005891
Task: 33749

commit_message:
Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we don't need to support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

Change-Id: I67b86898cb443dc02c6b41a78bfe54f43f8d6c74
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-13 17:21:14.000000000', 'message': 'WIP nova-live-migration: Wait for n-cpu services to come up after configuring Ceph

Change-Id: Icd7ab2ca4ddbed92c7e883a63a23245920d961e7
'}, {'created': '2020-03-13 20:13:45.000000000', 'message': 'WIP nova-live-migration: Wait for n-cpu services to come up after configuring Ceph

Change-Id: Icd7ab2ca4ddbed92c7e883a63a23245920d961e7
'}, {'created': '2020-03-19 11:15:14.000000000', 'message': 'nova-live-migration: Wait for n-cpu services to come up after configuring Ceph

Previously the ceph.sh script used during the nova-live-migration job
would only grep for a `compute` process when checking if the services
had been restarted. This check was bogus and would always return 0 as it
would always match itself. For example:

2020-03-13 21:06:47.682073 | primary | 2020-03-13 21:06:47.681 | root
29529  0.0  0.0   4500   736 pts/0    S+   21:06   0:00 /bin/sh -c ps
       aux | grep compute
2020-03-13 21:06:47.683964 | primary | 2020-03-13 21:06:47.683 | root
29531  0.0  0.0  14616   944 pts/0    S+   21:06   0:00 grep compute

Failures of this job were seen on the stable/pike branch where slower CI
nodes appeared to struggle to allow Libvirt to report to n-cpu in time
before Tempest was started. This in-turn caused instance build failures
and the overall failure of the job.

This change resolves this issue by switching to pgrep and ensuring
n-cpu services are reported as fully up after a cold restart before
starting the Tempest test run.

Closes-Bug: 1867380
Change-Id: Icd7ab2ca4ddbed92c7e883a63a23245920d961e7
(cherry picked from commit e23c3c2c8df3843c5853c87ef684bd21c4af95d8)
(cherry picked from commit 70447bca2f4f33c6872eaf94a2e4351bb257c22a)
(cherry picked from commit 373c4ffde2053c7ff11bd38339b88d144cd442f2)
(cherry picked from commit 8b89fdab746228766385b5b2c2b3d918e84862d8)
(cherry picked from commit 8940bb295d2e5943b1c04de9189ba7b31870ce19)

29529  0.0  0.0   4500   736 pts/0    S+   21:06   0:00 /bin/sh -c ps

29529  0.0  0.0   4500   736 pts/0    S+   21:06   0:00 /bin/sh -c ps
       aux | grep compute
2020-03-13 21:06:47.683964 | primary | 2020-03-13 21:06:47.683 | root
29531  0.0  0.0  14616   944 pts/0    S+   21:06   0:00 grep compute

Failures of this job were seen on the stable/pike branch where slower CI
nodes appeared to struggle to allow Libvirt to report to n-cpu in time
before Tempest was started. This in-turn caused instance build failures
and the overall failure of the job.

This change resolves this issue by switching to pgrep and ensuring
n-cpu services are reported as fully up after a cold restart before
starting the Tempest test run.

NOTE(lyarwood): I40f40766a7b84423c1dcf9d5ed58476b86d61cc4 is squashed
into this change to avoid endless retries trying to avoid bug #1867380
on stable/pike where it is currently hitting hard.

Replace ansible --sudo with --become in live_migration/hooks scripts

Ansible deprecated --sudo in 1.9 so this change replaces
it with --become.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict as Ifbadce909393268b340b7a08c78a6faa2d7888b2
can't be backported to stable/pike and as a result glance_api_version
needs to be set.

commit_message:
nova-live-migration: Wait for n-cpu services to come up after configuring Ceph

Previously the ceph.sh script used during the nova-live-migration job
would only grep for a `compute` process when checking if the services
had been restarted. This check was bogus and would always return 0 as it
would always match itself. For example:

2020-03-13 21:06:47.682073 | primary | 2020-03-13 21:06:47.681 | root
29529  0.0  0.0   4500   736 pts/0    S+   21:06   0:00 /bin/sh -c ps
       aux | grep compute
2020-03-13 21:06:47.683964 | primary | 2020-03-13 21:06:47.683 | root
29531  0.0  0.0  14616   944 pts/0    S+   21:06   0:00 grep compute

Failures of this job were seen on the stable/pike branch where slower CI
nodes appeared to struggle to allow Libvirt to report to n-cpu in time
before Tempest was started. This in-turn caused instance build failures
and the overall failure of the job.

This change resolves this issue by switching to pgrep and ensuring
n-cpu services are reported as fully up after a cold restart before
starting the Tempest test run.

NOTE(lyarwood): The following change is squashed here to avoid endless
retries in the gate due to bug #1867380.

Replace ansible --sudo with --become in live_migration/hooks scripts

Ansible deprecated --sudo in 1.9 so this change replaces
it with --become.

NOTE(lyarwood): Conflict due to
Ifbadce909393268b340b7a08c78a6faa2d7888b2 not being present in
stable/pike.

Conflicts:
    nova/tests/live_migration/hooks/ceph.sh

Change-Id: I40f40766a7b84423c1dcf9d5ed58476b86d61cc4
(cherry picked from commit 7f16800f71f6124736382be51d9da234800f7618)
(cherry picked from commit 18931544d8a57953c6ce9ee4bf4bcc7a4e9e4295)
(cherry picked from commit 1a09f753559aa7ed617192853215c5b0ace7756a)

Closes-Bug: 1867380
Change-Id: Icd7ab2ca4ddbed92c7e883a63a23245920d961e7
(cherry picked from commit e23c3c2c8df3843c5853c87ef684bd21c4af95d8)

commit_message:
Always build gerrit images on jeepyb changes

We have file matchers in system-config, but if we change
jeepyb at all we want to run the jobs.

Change-Id: If291cb03d2e6f6dfc24685414c640b9a9c944e00

commit_message:
[ussuri][goal] Updates for python 2.7 drop

OpenStack is dropping the py2.7 support in ussuri cycle.

charm repos need few updates on either py2 drop or updating
ussuri python template, tox.ini etc.

Complete discussion & schedule can be found in
- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2019-October/010142.html
- https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/drop-python2-support

Ussuri Communtiy-wide goal:
https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html

Change-Id: Ic12f0f83177d01cc646f433fa741b37598fbfa30

subject: Force container deletion if namespace does not exist in service_kill
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6681, 'name': 'Brent Eagles', 'email': 'beagles@redhat.com', 'username': 'beagles'}, {'_account_id': 6926, 'name': 'Bogdan Dobrelya', 'email': 'bdobreli@redhat.com', 'username': 'bogdando'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 28223, 'name': 'Cedric Jeanneret', 'display_name': 'cjeanner (Tengu)', 'email': 'cjeanner@redhat.com', 'username': 'cjeanner'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-23 18:49:15.000000000', 'message': 'Force container deletion if namespace does not exist in service_kill

When a service is stopped using "service_kill" script and the
namespace where the container is running does not exist, the
container processi should be forced to stop from the root namespace.

A namespace where a process is running, can be deleted whitout
stopping the mentioned process. "ip netns identify <PID>" then
returns an empty string (root namespace).

This patch will prevent an endless loop in Neutron DHCP agent. As
reported in the related bug, when a DHCP agent is resync, the DHCP
helper (metadata proxy) is stopped. In case this process stop raises
an exception (for example if the namespace does not exist), schedules
again a resync, creating an endless loop.

Change-Id: I9bac918fcde80e6a2336bc3cf1e6972512298118
Closes-Bug: #1868607
'}]
commit_message:
Force container deletion if namespace does not exist in service_kill

When a service is stopped using "service_kill" script and the
namespace where the container is running does not exist, the
container processi should be forced to stop from the root namespace.

A namespace where a process is running, can be deleted whitout
stopping the mentioned process. "ip netns identify <PID>" then
returns an empty string (root namespace).

This patch will prevent an endless loop in Neutron DHCP agent. As
reported in the related bug, when a DHCP agent is resync, the DHCP
helper (metadata proxy) is stopped. In case this process stop raises
an exception (for example if the namespace does not exist), schedules
again a resync, creating an endless loop.

Change-Id: I9bac918fcde80e6a2336bc3cf1e6972512298118
Closes-Bug: #1868607

commit_message:
Bump lower constraint of MarkupSafe

setuptools 46.0.0's drop of the Features feature broke
python-openstackclient's lower-constraints job on master
via the MarkupSafe package. Bump the lower constraint of
MarkupSafe to fix lower-constraints on master.

Change-Id: Ib0a6f94a6611b221efbf76f6f25b55c43782546f

commit_message:
tripleo_container_manage: improve logging for failed containers

If a container fails to start after many retries, the default logging of
the async_status tasks isn't great and it's hard to figure out what
container failed to start.

In this patch, we introduce a new filter that will read the
async_results and build a list of containers which failed to start
(failed to True) or did not finish to start (finished to 0); the
async_status ignores errors, but we fail a bit later after building that
list.

Change-Id: I5a2270130bdf5b9d781f4d81ec25c6ccf12fdc07

commit_message:
Set tox_constraints_file for npm jobs and integration tests

npm jobs and integration tests always try to use the constraints
from releases.openstack.org and do not pick up the change in the gate
even when Depends-On is specified.

For npm jobs, https://review.opendev.org/#/c/709414/ allows us to pass
tox_constraints_file when creating the envvar of the constraints file.
This commit consumes it.

Change-Id: I396073182ff1e63df12ebb79c3ddd646277ddadf

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-18 21:00:05.000000000', 'message': 'Filter out auth_token_info from logging values

auth_token_info is a common field that subclasses of RequestContext
add. It contains things like the token itself and the entire catalog,
both of which are undesirable to log. The token is a security concern
and the catalog is huge, which bloats the logs an unacceptable amount.

This change removes the auth_token_info key from the logging dict
that we return to the log formatter, which eliminates both problems.

Change-Id: If5ebaa3c1859d32cd05f51defe173fc625b21af5
Closes-Bug: 1866705
(cherry picked from commit 1dd72d1d209e699efc360ff99a20166aac831939)
'}]
commit_message:
Filter out auth_token_info from logging values

auth_token_info is a common field that subclasses of RequestContext
add. It contains things like the token itself and the entire catalog,
both of which are undesirable to log. The token is a security concern
and the catalog is huge, which bloats the logs an unacceptable amount.

This change removes the auth_token_info key from the logging dict
that we return to the log formatter, which eliminates both problems.

Change-Id: If5ebaa3c1859d32cd05f51defe173fc625b21af5
Closes-Bug: 1866705
(cherry picked from commit 1dd72d1d209e699efc360ff99a20166aac831939)
