commit_message:
Update upper-constraints for pyScss to 1.3.6

pyScss v1.3.6 is released with setuptools fix.

There is no need to blacklist setuptools 46.0.0 now,
so commit a8ff45ade2d817ca5b67457357bfe1cb2499caf5 is also reverted.

Change-Id: Ia8b27922f3354d42f62538ddee3ed5044968556d

commit_message:
repo_build: take distro version into account

When introducing a new repo_container with a different distro, using
the same directory for symlinks can result in weird builds. We should
prevent the links directory to be copied all willy-nilly, as suggested
here;

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712784/
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712787/

But we can further prevent bad builds by separating under distro-arch
under links with this patch.

Depends-On: Ieca6ec9bf898432c76c019a1d2d97c280cd85dce
Change-Id: I4ae6737f1ded4cbb680a380c8c309a0f5bf64723
(cherry picked from commit d5e33c8afa6401392f9286f9cf3ffe7bc1a5bc8e)

commit_message:
RFC: remove influxdb chart support

Per midcycle [0], this patch set removes influxdb chart due to the
lack of use. Users are encouraged to use the upstream chart [1].

[0] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/osh-virtual-ptg-2020-03
[1] https://github.com/helm/charts/tree/master/stable/influxdb

Change-Id: I0d3d51847881fcb68ba182a2a9370869e5040ad4
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Fix version locks

In order to lock to a specific minor release we need to specify all 3
numbers or it will pick up the next minor release. For 6.11 we were
getting 6.14.0 when the job run which is the same as the latest.

Conflicts:
	zuul.d/libraries.yaml
	zuul.d/unit.yaml

Change-Id: Idab2b1bd50ae316d9d26f5616174a3421f22b571
(cherry picked from commit 92954b3da121573e403077f4067eea0b1087d5e8)

commit_message:
pacemaker-remote is broken on CentOS/RHEL < 8

Broken since commit 16c5f1692580d7fc42985d8895828eb71433af09
The problem is when setting use_pcsd to true, the new
pcs 0.10 remote addition is always used, which doesn't work
on CentOS/RHEL before 8.

Change-Id: I9b04c1bb5a2389201b99815f17d6242baaf856d9
Closes-bug: #1850058

commit_message:
Change OVS tunnel tests to support unittest.mock

The unit tests in test_ovs_tunnel.py were verifying that
port_exists() was calling bool(), which fails when using
unittest.mock.  Since it doesn't really gain anything,
just remove the check for that exact call.

Trivialfix

Change-Id: Id7712330a24f51f0cfee8d7b3916c05d3501ee3f

problems for consuming projects. A fix is on the way. Until then, let's
blacklist this version.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-02-21 20:25:20.000000000', 'message': "Enforce os-traits/SUPPORTED_STORAGE_BUSES sync

Following on from [1], beef up the unit test for libvirt's
_get_storage_bus_traits helper to ensure that we're reporting all and
only the buses corresponding to os-traits COMPUTE_STORAGE_BUS_* traits.
This will force us to keep nova and os-traits in sync:

- If we add a new COMPUTE_STORAGE_BUS_* trait without adding it to nova,
  this test will fail in the py* tox job.
- If we add a new COMPUTE_STORAGE_BUS_* trait and add its corresponding
  bus name in nova but forget to bump our os-traits minimum, the test
  will fail in the lower-constraints job.

And for completeness:

- If we add a new bus name without adding a corresponding trait, the
  test will fail (this was true before this commit as well).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666914/20/nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py@23087

Change-Id: I08b2a888b89e0329d9aa22b9ecbb901a2ee42145
"}]
commit_message:
Enforce os-traits/SUPPORTED_STORAGE_BUSES sync

Following on from [1], beef up the unit test for libvirt's
_get_storage_bus_traits helper to ensure that we're reporting all and
only the buses corresponding to os-traits COMPUTE_STORAGE_BUS_* traits.
This will force us to keep nova and os-traits in sync:

- If we add a new COMPUTE_STORAGE_BUS_* trait without adding it to nova,
  this test will fail in the py* tox job.
- If we add a new COMPUTE_STORAGE_BUS_* trait and add its corresponding
  bus name in nova but forget to bump our os-traits minimum, the test
  will fail in the lower-constraints job.

And for completeness:

- If we add a new bus name without adding a corresponding trait, the
  test will fail (this was true before this commit as well).

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/666914/20/nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py@23087

Change-Id: I08b2a888b89e0329d9aa22b9ecbb901a2ee42145

commit_message:
Change TestOVNL3RouterPlugin to support unittest.mock

There were a few issues in this class preventing it from
working with unittest.mock:

 - patching the same object multiple times
 - neutron-lib get_admin_context() mocking

Functionally things shouldn't be any different, even though
some code duplication was removed.

Change-Id: Iddc232c4be46192463e1b69298fa56f5aca359c3

subject: Revert "Revert "Disable github reporting and re-add devel ansible job""
messages: [{'account_id': 1, 'date': '2020-03-24 15:55:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2020-03-24 15:56:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2020-03-24 15:56:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-24 15:55:27.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Revert "Disable github reporting and re-add devel ansible job""

This reverts commit 9e9aeff0fc998bebfe045fc865797b102d4ec8d4.

We were not done debugging.  In fact, we hadn't even started debugging,
so revert the revert of the job removal.  Here's the justification for
the original revert:

We had a job trigger that shouldn't have. Re-add the job so
we can debug why that happened. Because we're debugging, turn of

subject: DNM/POC/RFC Allow multi distro/arch builds
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-23 16:13:43.000000000', 'message': "DNM/POC/RFC Allow multi distro/arch builds

This patch could/should probably be split in two, one for syncing
and one for building.

Building:
  We check all the hosts in the ansible_play_batch for distro/arch
exactly the same as venv_build_targets, and then we flatten that
structure to a list of venv_build_requesters. The
python_venv_wheel_build was set to run_once, because we only needed
it to build once for the single distro/arch, but now we can pick
out one host for every distro/arch and have it request a build to
it's corresponding repo_container/distro/arch via venv_build_host.

Synchronizing:
  If packages are built on repo_all[0] we just move them into
venv_build_host_wheel_path, and if on any other host, we rsync the
files over to repo_all[0] for further distribution. (Shamelessly
ripped from the old repo_build.)

My suggestion would be two patches,
1) sync
2) building with a depends on sync

Thoughts?

Change-Id: Ib6ecea1eaaf5dfdedf4e683c1ae1b5619dcbabf4
"}]
commit_message:
DNM/POC/RFC Allow multi distro/arch builds

This patch could/should probably be split in two, one for syncing
and one for building.

Building:
  We check all the hosts in the ansible_play_batch for distro/arch
exactly the same as venv_build_targets, and then we flatten that
structure to a list of venv_build_requesters. The
python_venv_wheel_build was set to run_once, because we only needed
it to build once for the single distro/arch, but now we can pick
out one host for every distro/arch and have it request a build to
it's corresponding repo_container/distro/arch via venv_build_host.

Synchronizing:
  If packages are built on repo_all[0] we just move them into
venv_build_host_wheel_path, and if on any other host, we rsync the
files over to repo_all[0] for further distribution. (Shamelessly
ripped from the old repo_build.)

My suggestion would be two patches,
1) sync
2) building with a depends on sync

Thoughts?

Change-Id: Ib6ecea1eaaf5dfdedf4e683c1ae1b5619dcbabf4

messages: [{'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2020-03-20 00:47:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 25600, 'date': '2020-03-20 13:20:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2020-03-23 10:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2020-03-24 15:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-20 00:47:05.000000000', 'message': 'repo_build: Do not sync links directory between repo_containers

The links directory is only used by repo_build when creating requirement
wheels. The repo_build process builds wheels for it's own distro/arch combo
in serial. So in a mixed environment, where you might have ubuntu-16.04-x86_64
and ubuntu-18.04-x86_64 repo_containers, heck even centos-7-x86_64 for that
matter, copying the links pointing to pools/distro-arch over to another
repo_container creating wheels for a different distro/arch leads to bad builds
getting deployed later.

We also need to prevent the later lsync config from spreading these out
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705390/

We can prevent this mix-up from happening even further by setting
repo_build_global_links_path: "{{ repo_build_base_path }}/links/{{ repo_build_os_distro_version }}"
as suggested in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708115/

This is probably only relevant for stable/rocky.
Depends-On: Ieca6ec9bf898432c76c019a1d2d97c280cd85dce
Change-Id: I3bd6d3d987e32ee11c5f1fcb5c1b4b0fc797e7f9
(cherry picked from commit 4bd52916e724046ca3b138e55b443d730547c0b6)
'}]
commit_message:
repo_build: Do not sync links directory between repo_containers

The links directory is only used by repo_build when creating requirement
wheels. The repo_build process builds wheels for it's own distro/arch combo
in serial. So in a mixed environment, where you might have ubuntu-16.04-x86_64
and ubuntu-18.04-x86_64 repo_containers, heck even centos-7-x86_64 for that
matter, copying the links pointing to pools/distro-arch over to another
repo_container creating wheels for a different distro/arch leads to bad builds
getting deployed later.

We also need to prevent the later lsync config from spreading these out
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/705390/

We can prevent this mix-up from happening even further by setting
repo_build_global_links_path: "{{ repo_build_base_path }}/links/{{ repo_build_os_distro_version }}"
as suggested in https://review.opendev.org/#/c/708115/

This is probably only relevant for stable/rocky.
Depends-On: Ieca6ec9bf898432c76c019a1d2d97c280cd85dce
Change-Id: I3bd6d3d987e32ee11c5f1fcb5c1b4b0fc797e7f9
(cherry picked from commit 4bd52916e724046ca3b138e55b443d730547c0b6)

commit_message:
repo_build: take distro version into account

When introducing a new repo_container with a different distro, using
the same directory for symlinks can result in weird builds. We should
prevent the links directory to be copied all willy-nilly, as suggested
here;

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712784/
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/712787/

But we can further prevent bad builds by separating under distro-arch
under links with this patch.

Depends-On: Ieca6ec9bf898432c76c019a1d2d97c280cd85dce
Change-Id: I4ae6737f1ded4cbb680a380c8c309a0f5bf64723
(cherry picked from commit d5e33c8afa6401392f9286f9cf3ffe7bc1a5bc8e)

commit_message:
Add knowledge of storage network to scenario tests

In many deployments, shared file systems are exported
over a shared storage network. Typically, this shared
storage network is not reachable from within
private tenant networks. Our tests currently
have no cognizance of this topology, and expect that
shares are always exported on a network routable or
directly reachable through private tenant networks.

Add a configuration option to allow configuring the
name or UUID of a shared storage network. If specified
this network will be plugged into VMs created by the
scenario tests and access control will be on the
storage network IP, if NFS.

Change-Id: I8d8063d46284076499d868a5f9b3d13a2a78b5b0
Signed-off-by: Goutham Pacha Ravi <gouthampravi@gmail.com>

hi, Tom and Goutham Pacha Ravi.
As for this bug, I think the most direct way to fix it is modify the database layer's API logic. Please look at the following code.
manila/db/sqlalchemy/api.py:1426 ---> def share_instance_get();

@require_context
def share_instance_get(context, share_instance_id, session=None,
                       with_share_data=False):
    if session is None:
        session = get_session()
    result = model_query(
        context, models.ShareInstance, session=session,
    ).filter_by(
        id=share_instance_id,
    ).options(
        joinedload('export_locations'),
        joinedload('share_type'),
    ).first()
    if result is None:
        raise exception.NotFound()

    parent_share = share_get(context, result['share_id'], session=session)
    if not context.is_admin:
        if not parent_share['is_public'] \
                and context.project_id != parent_share['project_id']:
            raise exception.NotFound()
    if with_share_data:
        result.set_share_data(parent_share)

    return result

in this function, we determine whether the share instance belong to the project of context. how do you think about it?"}, {'account_id': 16643, 'date': '2020-03-09 21:02:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

> hi, Tom and Goutham Pacha Ravi.
> As for this bug, I think the most direct way to fix it is modify the database layer's API logic. Please look at the following code.
> manila/db/sqlalchemy/api.py:1426 ---> def share_instance_get();

Hi Haixin, yes that fix would work as well. However, it may not be any more direct than the change Tom's making in this patch. In general, we should probably secure gathering resources via the db_api by setting "project_only" [1] to True by default. We will explore that route on the master branch - I don't wish to make a sweeping change like that in the fear that our testing may not be adequate.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/manila/src/commit/ef6b9a0c72a0e47d7345286911a3d882ee1f1909/manila/db/sqlalchemy/api.py#L238'}, {'account_id': 9003, 'date': '2020-03-16 20:02:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

@haixin, @gouthamr: Would it make sense to merge and backport this, then to merge Haixin's patch on master branch?"}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2020-03-17 07:07:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

hi, Tom and Goutham Pacha Ravi.
i have try to solve this bug with "project_only" set to True.
here is the link:https://review.opendev.org/#/c/713376/
we can discuss about this bug.'}, {'account_id': 30407, 'date': '2020-03-17 09:19:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+1

as gouthamr said " I don't wish to make a sweeping change like that in the fear that our testing may not be adequate." i agree merge this patch, my patch is Just a Just a sample, for reference onlysample, for reference only,Because there's a lot of room for optimization.'}, {'account_id': 29632, 'date': '2020-03-17 12:10:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

commit_message:
Missed variable redefinition during cleanup.

In [1] we cleanup some variables that were barely used. The
"undercloud_update_template" was cleaned up but we forgot to remove it
from usage in the templates..

[1] I443865bc95590a5cffcc28d98913110238e863b6

Change-Id: I98b232f370a56d2635e49c8be244b16909f12ae8

[{'created': '2020-03-23 14:18:42.000000000', 'message': 'NetApp SolidFire: Fix NetApp SolidFire SSL option

The driver.verify_ssl atribute is being defined before its usage in
the _create_cluster_reference() causing the driver initialization
to fail.

(cherry picked from commit 9089982ef14482a132ef4da578ab0df22908a044)

Change-Id: Ic616bbcced22db6eb8c8946dec98aefd84b16c31
(cherry picked from commit ee974f98a19fd6fa625f1e74dc021fb7bcf1692e)
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp SolidFire: Fix NetApp SolidFire SSL option

The driver.verify_ssl atribute is being defined before its usage in
the _create_cluster_reference() causing the driver initialization
to fail.

(cherry picked from commit 9089982ef14482a132ef4da578ab0df22908a044)

Change-Id: Ic616bbcced22db6eb8c8946dec98aefd84b16c31
(cherry picked from commit ee974f98a19fd6fa625f1e74dc021fb7bcf1692e)

commit_message:
Disable github reporting and re-add devel ansible job

We had a job trigger that shouldn't have. Re-add the job so
we can debug why that happened. Because we're debugging, turn off
all github reporting.

Revert "Stop running against devel of ansible/ansible"

This reverts commit 594efcf712087db8a55c553bcb48e89fa638154.

Change-Id: I52ee1533fea0fcbf68eaee3a73c0e666a284f3c3

I would be honestly not fan of removing ThreadExecutor completely - I would like to have possibility to use SDK without same additional glue from multiple places I implement this for.
Doing something like "project_cleanup" and "project_cleanup_threaded" might be an option thou. Would it be better from your POV?'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2020-02-20 13:43:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

commit_message:
Lay a foundation for the project cleanup

During Berlin Summit 2018 it was decided to start implementation
of the project cleanup in the SDK. This is a foundation for that
with the required bits and few examples in the services to demonstrate
the interface.

In the followup changes following should be done:
- review cleanup in service proxies (the ones implemented and not)
- describe the feature in the documentation
- start consuming this service from the OSC (need help deciding where
should it be implemented - core OSC, separate project, OSC plugin in
SDK, ...)

Change-Id: Ie29d10475e8d1af1beea3cc5b45984f2be9236ef

messages: [{'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-24 14:12:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2020-03-24 14:30:45.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nSwitching project to use openstackdocstheme.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-24 14:12:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add sphinx-rtd-theme package

This package is used by adjutant-ui. No requirements jobs were
configured for that repo, so it was not found to be an issue until
attempting to add them.

* Is the library actively maintained?

Yes. Appears to be maintained by the ReadTheDocs team with the latest
commit being a couple weeks ago.

* Is the library good code?

Code looks good with decent unit test coverage.

* Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes. Tox environments cover 2.7, 3.5, 3.6, and 3.7.

* Is the library license compatible?

Yes. All provided with MIT License.

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
(Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Only Ubuntu 19.10 so far.

* Is the function of this library already covered
by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?

No.

* Is the library required for OpenStack project
or related dev or infrastructure setup?

In use by adjutant-ui.

* If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process
 does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

N/A

Change-Id: Ic9dcae3630f195126956289699d3e7428b133427
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add sphinx-rtd-theme package

This package is used by adjutant-ui. No requirements jobs were
configured for that repo, so it was not found to be an issue until
attempting to add them.

* Is the library actively maintained?

Yes. Appears to be maintained by the ReadTheDocs team with the latest
commit being a couple weeks ago.

* Is the library good code?

Code looks good with decent unit test coverage.

* Is the library python 3 compatible?

Yes. Tox environments cover 2.7, 3.5, 3.6, and 3.7.

* Is the library license compatible?

Yes. All provided with MIT License.

* Is the library already packaged in the distros we target
(Ubuntu latest / Fedora latest)?

Only Ubuntu 19.10 so far.

* Is the function of this library already covered
by other libraries in global-requirements.txt?

No.

* Is the library required for OpenStack project
or related dev or infrastructure setup?

In use by adjutant-ui.

* If the library release is managed by the Openstack release process
 does it use the cycle-with-intermediary release type?

N/A

Change-Id: Ic9dcae3630f195126956289699d3e7428b133427
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

That's not what this change does.  As you can see, there are no jobs configured to run on the devel branch.  They were removed in https://review.opendev.org/714631"}, {'account_id': 10969, 'date': '2020-03-24 14:11:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Remove devel branch for ansible openstack jobs

Ansible devel branch shouldn't run openstack jobs anymore,
since openstack ansible modules were removed from devel branch.
Change-Id: Iaf6575b2652c1e2da397b5e557ce0ed55ed12ad2

questions.  After some review at the Ussuri PTG
in Shanghai the TC has come up with the following
analysis.

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-02 16:42:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add "fields" parameter to ListSecurityGroup query

This new query parameter will allow to send a query sending the
"fields" parameter. This "fields" parameter contains the needed
OVO fields that require to be retrieved from the DB.

As commented in the related bug, the OS client "list" command only
prints five parameters, none of them the security group rules. In
systems with a reasonable amount of security groups, skipping the
unnecessary rule load can save a lot of time.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710820/
Change-Id: I16f48e292997d029d68f66365db949b9f4b5a0c8
Closes-Bug: #1865223

commit_message:
Add "fields" parameter to ListSecurityGroup query

This new query parameter will allow to send a query sending the
"fields" parameter. This "fields" parameter contains the needed
API fields, translated into OVO fields in Neutron server, that
require to be retrieved from the DB.

As commented in the related bug, the OSC "list" command only
prints five parameters, none of them the security group rules. In
systems with a reasonable amount of security groups, skipping the
unnecessary rule load can save a lot of time.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/710820/
Change-Id: I16f48e292997d029d68f66365db949b9f4b5a0c8
Closes-Bug: #1865223

Make tempest-multinode-full py2 job on py2

of mutlinode testing for stable branches and

commit_message:
[WIP] Enable IGMP snooping by default

Multicast support has been introduced in core OVN upstream.
This patch is enabling IGMP snooping by default on all the
Logical Switches.

TODO:

* Functional tests
* Maintenance task to update previously created lswitches

Co-Authored-By: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I5189ce31682c7501cdff7a74bc824b8491377549
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2020-03-23 10:02:39.000000000', 'message': 'HA: check before restarting resource on stack update

When container <service>_restart_bundle is run, it checks whether
it can call pcs to restart the associated pacemaker resource, when
applicable.
Make sure we enforce the checks in all cases (when we run during
a stack update / update converge, and during a minor update).

Closes-Bug: #1868533

commit_message:
HA: check before restarting resource on stack update

When container <service>_restart_bundle is run, it checks whether
it can call pcs to restart the associated pacemaker resource, when
applicable.
Make sure we enforce the checks in all cases (when we run during
a stack update / update converge, and during a minor update).

Change-Id: I0367a657ddf440f0b73c4de5346306f12439db15
Closes-Bug: #1868533

commit_message:
Add warning about avoiding artl_gzip option

This should prevent future accidents of adding artcl_gzip option inside
this file, which overrides any other environment specific values.

Change-Id: Icc9201cfc74a131767316955a57649b2eb377d78
Closes-Bug: #1861378
Signed-off-by: Sorin Sbarnea <ssbarnea@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Implement validations-libs Run method for tripleoclient

Remove validations run code and call validations-libs
instead for Run command in tripleoclient.

The results management should move away as an utils
function in validations-libs.

Some options should be nice to implement in the
validation tripleoclient cli

Change-Id: Ie264d7631aba9b8beb9962e1694446f6968170e5

commit_message:
Fluentd: Add fluent-plugin-prometheus

This change adds the official prometheus plugin
to our fluentd image, which provides better metrics
than the exporter side car currently being used in
our chart.

Change-Id: I8fa874ead4e397e73302d4d571e78644d7982f6c

commit_message:
[OVN] Fix: DevStack guide

* Fix the path for the sample files
* Change the title to include the word OVN
* Remove the networking-ovn references
* Fix host OS versions recommendations
* Run "nova-manage cell_v2 discover_hosts" prior to listing the
  hypervisors

Change-Id: Id2ce2a8913a9fb5ce9482b360dea9503a0b279da
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-16 12:19:09.000000000', 'message': 'WIP [L3HA] Fix sending MLDv2 packets from gw ports on backup nodes

This patch is work in progress still. There are no any tests for now
created for it. I first would like to know what L3 experts from our team
thinks about this idea.

In some cases, e.g. after network node reboot, there may be race
between neutron-l3-agent which is configuring routers with gateway
ports (qg-XXX) in router's namespace and neutron-openvswitch-agent
which is wiring such port in br-int.
If neutron-openvswitch-agent will do its job before neutron-l3-agent
removes IPv6 link-local addresses from such qg-XXX port, MLDv2 packets
from this interface will be send to the wire. That will cause learning
where qg-XXX's MAC address is by ToR switch and it will cause break
in connectivity to the router.

To avoid that, this patch introduces new flag "bind_device" which is
set by L3 agent in port's other_config. For L3 HA case this flag is
set to "no" initially. If value of this flag is set to "no" than
neutron-openvswitch-agent will not set proper tag for such port and
will keep DEAD_VLAN (4095) tag on it thus MLDv2 packets send from this
interface will be dropped in br-int.
After neutron-l3-agent will finish all configuration for such port,
which means that it will e.g. remove IPv6 link-local addresses from it,
it will set this flag to "yes" and then neutron-openvswitch-agent will
finish wiring the port in br-int and set proper tag.

Change-Id: I9e7e20679b41847810696307f05dd9b7b252ab88
Closes-Bug: #1859832
'}, {'created': '2020-01-30 14:21:43.000000000', 'message': 'WIP [L3HA] Fix sending MLDv2 packets from gw ports on backup nodes

In some cases, e.g. after network node reboot, there may be race
between neutron-l3-agent which is configuring routers with gateway
ports (qg-XXX) in router's namespace and neutron-openvswitch-agent
which is wiring such port in br-int.
If neutron-openvswitch-agent will do its job before neutron-l3-agent
removes IPv6 link-local addresses from such qg-XXX port, MLDv2 packets
from this interface will be send to the wire. That will cause learning
where qg-XXX's MAC address is by ToR switch and it will cause break
in connectivity to the router.

To avoid that, this patch introduces new flag "internal_status" which is
set by L3 agent in port's other_config. For L3 HA case this flag is
set to "inactive" initially. If value of this flag is set to "inactive" than
neutron-openvswitch-agent will not set proper tag for such port and
will keep DEAD_VLAN (4095) tag on it thus MLDv2 packets send from this
interface will be dropped in br-int.
After neutron-l3-agent will finish all configuration for such port,
which means that it will e.g. remove IPv6 link-local addresses from it,
it will set this flag to "active" and then neutron-openvswitch-agent will
finish wiring the port in br-int and set proper tag.

Change-Id: I9e7e20679b41847810696307f05dd9b7b252ab88
Closes-Bug: #1859832
'}, {'created': '2020-01-30 16:10:32.000000000', 'message': '[L3HA] Fix sending MLDv2 packets from gw ports on backup nodes

In some cases, e.g. after network node reboot, there may be race
between neutron-l3-agent which is configuring routers with gateway
ports (qg-XXX) in router's namespace and neutron-openvswitch-agent
which is wiring such port in br-int.
If neutron-openvswitch-agent will do its job before neutron-l3-agent
removes IPv6 link-local addresses from such qg-XXX port, MLDv2 packets
from this interface will be send to the wire. That will cause learning
where qg-XXX's MAC address is by ToR switch and it will cause break
in connectivity to the router.

To avoid that, this patch introduces new flag "internal_status" which is
set by L3 agent in port's other_config. For L3 HA case this flag is
set to "inactive" initially. If value of this flag is set to "inactive" than
neutron-openvswitch-agent will not set proper tag for such port and
will keep DEAD_VLAN (4095) tag on it thus MLDv2 packets send from this
interface will be dropped in br-int.
After neutron-l3-agent will finish all configuration for such port,
which means that it will e.g. remove IPv6 link-local addresses from it,
it will set this flag to "active" and then neutron-openvswitch-agent will
finish wiring the port in br-int and set proper tag.

Change-Id: I9e7e20679b41847810696307f05dd9b7b252ab88
Closes-Bug: #1859832

commit_message:
[L3HA] Fix sending MLDv2 packets from gw ports on backup nodes

In some cases, e.g. after network node reboot, there may be race
between neutron-l3-agent which is configuring routers with gateway
ports (qg-XXX) in router's namespace and neutron-openvswitch-agent
which is wiring such port in br-int.
If neutron-openvswitch-agent will do its job before neutron-l3-agent
removes IPv6 link-local addresses from such qg-XXX port, MLDv2 packets
from this interface will be send to the wire. That will cause learning
where qg-XXX's MAC address is by ToR switch and it will cause break
in connectivity to the router.

To avoid that, this patch introduces new flag "internal_status" which is
set by L3 agent in port's other_config. For L3 HA case this flag is
set to "inactive" initially. If value of this flag is set to "inactive" than
neutron-openvswitch-agent will not set proper tag for such port and
will keep DEAD_VLAN (4095) tag on it thus MLDv2 packets send from this
interface will be dropped in br-int.
After neutron-l3-agent will finish all configuration for such port,
which means that it will e.g. remove IPv6 link-local addresses from it,
it will set this flag to "active" and then neutron-openvswitch-agent will
finish wiring the port in br-int and set proper tag.

Change-Id: I9e7e20679b41847810696307f05dd9b7b252ab88
Closes-Bug: #1859832

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-03-19 04:35:47.000000000', 'message': 'Delete neutron ports for Failed/Succeeded pods

This covers the scenario presented by k8s jobs in which the pods
are completed after the job and result in either Failed or Succeeded
state. Kubelet calls the CNI DEL for such pods so we should also delete
the neutron port and the corresponding annotation.

Change-Id: I513784139b361da609f66dc2128970c8eae784c5
Signed-off-by: Nayan Deshmukh <n.deshmukh@samsung.com>

Change-Id: I513784139b361da609f66dc2128970c8eae784c5
Signed-off-by: Nayan Deshmukh <n.deshmukh@samsung.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Delete neutron ports for Failed/Succeeded pods

This covers the scenario presented by k8s jobs in which the pods
are completed after the job and result in either Failed or Succeeded
state. Kubelet calls the CNI DEL for such pods so we should also delete
the neutron port and the corresponding annotation.

Closes-Bug: 1868074
Change-Id: I513784139b361da609f66dc2128970c8eae784c5
Signed-off-by: Nayan Deshmukh <n.deshmukh@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Add new repositories under TripleO governance

Those repositories being linked to validations, it makes sense to put
them in the "tripleo-validations" set. Some renaming might come later,
but for now, it's more than OK like that.

Depends-On: I149801b88484258fa05dabd1bc6a471462199e4c
Change-Id: I545338f21b0ef308f524e585c44801eab8d3cac6

We need to calculate assignments based on tracked instances and
migrations, so we take orphan instances and error migrations into
consideration since there may be resources occupied by them but
not cleaned up.

Besides, we update existing periodic task _cleanup_incomplete_migrations
and _cleanup_running_deleted to improve the cleanup, including
specific resource cleanup like vpmems.

commit_message:
Track orphan instances and error migrations in resource tracker

We need to calculate assignments based on tracked instances and
migrations, so we take orphan instances and error migrations into
consideration since there may be resources occupied by them but
not cleaned up.

Besides, we update existing periodic task _cleanup_incomplete_migrations
and _cleanup_running_deleted to improve the cleanup, including
specific resource cleanup like vpmems.

Change-Id: Ida8dc7a01db096c269ef18656c5a373ce08ee58c

commit_message:
Add devstack-plugin-nfs project under QA

devstack-plugin-nfs is devstack plugin to
configure the NFS backend.

We are going to bring this plugin under QA
project.

Detail discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-March/013048.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/711834/

commit_message:
Add non-default Redfish service mount location

The `--service-endpoint` option can now contain a path
to Redfish API mount point. If not set, it defaults
to sushy default which is `redfish/v1`.

Change-Id: Ic7737b92c70af738c7998e412cb59d149418542e

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-01-12 08:49:26.000000000', 'message': 'Drop use of unittest2

unittest2 was needed for Python versions <= 2.6, so it has not been
needed for quite awhile (ever in this project). See unittest2 note on:

https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html

This drops unittest2 in favor of the standard unittest module.

Change-Id: I21264290d783d582dfb886b799781380dbf5757d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Drop use of unittest2

unittest2 was needed for Python versions <= 2.6, so it has not been
needed for quite awhile (ever in this project). See unittest2 note on:

https://docs.python.org/2.7/library/unittest.html

This drops unittest2 in favor of the standard unittest module.

Change-Id: I21264290d783d582dfb886b799781380dbf5757d
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Explicitly set ramdisk type

The ironic-lib-base job is based on ironic-base job which
will default to dib.
To prevent breaking the ironic-lib CI we set the ramdisk
type to tinyipa for now and we'll convert the jobs here later.

Change-Id: I9a03943a838b53518b052874296744c97feea249

The timeout command defaults to using TERM which does
not always ensure that it will end soon enough. The
ansible-playbook command should end as soon as possible.

Closes-Bug: #1867968
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
config-download timeout should KILL the process.

The timeout command defaults to using TERM which does
not always ensure that it will end soon enough. The
ansible-playbook command should end as soon as possible.

Change-Id: I0f97772434040f04f9495239b9a432c1ac062555
Closes-Bug: #1867968
Signed-off-by: Luke Short <ekultails@gmail.com>

subject: Add nodes tagging support - API

commit_message:
Add nodes tagging support - API

- set node tags
- get a list of tags of a node
- remove all tags from a node
- node list tags/tags_any/not_tags/not_tags_any
  filter support
- include tags in node details

Partial-bug: #1526266
Co-Authored-By: Vladyslav Drok <vdrok@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I027e024364bea73babbbd5cb9be22cab1f9ca3f1
